name: Hilo/Papa'ikou--Hale Melia
summary: Separate entrance to room and private bathroom in our 104 year old home. No kitchen, but bedroom has small space with mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, hot pot, and dishes, tea, coffee sugar, honey.  We have a 2 dogs and 1 cat on premises, We do not allow them in guest room.   It is 4 miles to Hilo Bayfront ( 15 -20 minute drive), 8 miles to Hilo airport, 12 miles to Akaka Falls, 34 miles to Volcano National Park 1 hour to Hawaiian vanilla farm, 1 hour to top of Mauna Kea.
space: We are a part of an old sugar plantation family oriented community.  Our yard has some native plants as well as lei making and kapa making plants.  You are welcome to sit on the porch with view of our amazing Plumeria tree, and watch the butterflies visit our crown flower plant.  We have two very friendly dogs and one cat.  We do not allow them into guest space, but they do like to hang out on porch.  neighbors have dogs, and of course coqui frogs that chirp in evening.
description: Separate entrance to room and private bathroom in our 104 year old home. No kitchen, but bedroom has small space with mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, hot pot, and dishes, tea, coffee sugar, honey.  We have a 2 dogs and 1 cat on premises, We do not allow them in guest room.   It is 4 miles to Hilo Bayfront ( 15 -20 minute drive), 8 miles to Hilo airport, 12 miles to Akaka Falls, 34 miles to Volcano National Park 1 hour to Hawaiian vanilla farm, 1 hour to top of Mauna Kea. We are a part of an old sugar plantation family oriented community.  Our yard has some native plants as well as lei making and kapa making plants.  You are welcome to sit on the porch with view of our amazing Plumeria tree, and watch the butterflies visit our crown flower plant.  We have two very friendly dogs and one cat.  We do not allow them into guest space, but they do like to hang out on porch.  neighbors have dogs, and of course coqui frogs that chirp in evening. Porch and garden. We respect your privacy,
neighborhood_overview: A piece of old Hawai'i, we have been renovating a 104 year old home that is a part of a family oriented neighborhood of homes formerly a part of Silverton Camp sugar plantation.  15 to 20 minute drive to downtown Hilo. An easy drive to Onomea Scenic Drive, Akaka Falls, downtown Hilo, Rainbow Falls, and about one hour to Volcano National Park.
notes: Please let us know right away of any problems or concerns, we want you to enjoy your stay.
transit: Need a car.
access: Porch and garden.
interaction: We respect your privacy, but just ask and we will love to share our favorite places to visit and best places to eat.
house_rules: No smoking.

host.host_about:
We have really enjoy having guests.  We learn something new about hosting from each guest, and we really want all guests to enjoy their stay.  We have put everything we can think of in our listing, but we are happy to answer any questions and continue to update our listing.  It seems that some guests were unable to access some information We put in the app, so we encourage contacting us with any questions.
We came from California 14 years ago.  Glenn is a handyman, and has done an amazing job of saving this 104 year old home, originally built for sugar plantation workers.  I am a recently retired special education preschool teacher.  I love to garden and have tried to add as many native Hawaiian.  lei making plants and fruit trees as possible.  We try to be very respectful of Hawaiian culture and history.  We would be happy to share what we know with you.

reviews.comments: Glenn and Mary Mahina and I enjoy our staying at your place and look forward to do business with you guys in the future Mahalo nuiloa and Aloha

Fantastic place to stay, private entrance was really nice.
Bed was comfortable and room was nicely furnished!
Glenn and Mary are the sweetest couple you will find for hosts! Fresh fruit and the garden was lovely!
A++++++

Glenn and Mary just started hosting on airbnb, and they have the cutest place just about 10 minutes north of Hilo, in a nice, older neighborhood with old plantation style homes. Very picturesque. Kind size bed, very comfortable,  full bathroom, little kitchenette space, nice closet, flat screen TV with DVD player and nice selection of DVDs. Super clean, supplied everything, even fruit in the fridge, a very nice surprise. Super friendly people, easy to talk to, and a great dog named Maddy. I really enjoyed myself.

Mary & Glenn's studio is Adorable and so are they!! I arrived at night in a down pour - and Mary met me outside with an umbrella!! They are so lovely and have put a Lot of Energy into making this studio super cute!! They provide absolutely everything you need for your stay!!  It is 4 miles North of Hilo - very convenient and easy to find.  It is in a very quiet neighborhood - the only thing I heard all night was the chorus of frogs and birds.  There is a code lock on the door to your own little apartment - it far exceeded my expectations - the photos do not do it justice.

I highly recommend staying here - it's clean - cute - and quiet - and Mary & Glenn are very gracious hosts.

This AirBnB is perfect. A true AirBnB. Fresh fruit, taro bread, juice, water, and coffee fill the kitchen. The area is extremely clean. The bed is super comfortable. The bathroom is stocked full of all the amenities anyone could ask for. The lot is beautiful. Glenn and Mary are great. I really have no bad things to say. 10/10 would recommend to anyone staying in the area in the future.
Great place to crash last minute.. although I had trouble finding the area, Glen came out and helped ! Very beautiful garden

Mary & Glenn were very helpful and flexible with my check in and check out times prior to my stay. The bed is comfortable, bathroom is nice and room is equipped with a microwave and small fridge and the separate entrance is always a bonus. I didn't get a chance to meet Glenn, but Mary was very sweet and helpful.

Beautiful private room with very nice bath, a place to make coffee in the morning and a place to park your car. We had a great time there and it was the best Air BnB experience I have had so far. Mary and Glenn are so nice and provided everything for us, really easy access to the room due to a number lock, fruits and delicious Taro buns in the morning, information about Hilo and all in all a welcoming and lovely experience. I highly recommend this place and would love to stay there again. Thank you!

We absolutely loved staying at this place! Our favorite out of two weeks in Hawaii. It is very close to Hilo, but just far away enough to be quiet and residential. The space was well-equipped with amenities, more so than we were expecting. Glenn and Mary were friendly and available whenever we needed them. Lovely garden and property, too. Excellent place!

It was our first time doing an airbnb and we had a great stay here!  The room is spacious, has all the amenities we needed, and has a separate entrance to the house.  The couple communicated very well and made us feel at ease.  We would highly recommend choosing a stay here!

Great location just minutes away from downtown Hilo, but with a very country feel. Private beach at the end of their road, a 15 minute walk at the most, very special. Clean space, private bath, small kitchenette area with mini-fridge, coffee maker and hot pot. Sweet dog and cat. Glenn and Mary are great people!

We enjoyed the night we spent at this airbnb.  The room was a comfortable size; comfortable bed and well appointed with everything we needed.  Bathroom was clean and fresh. Appreciated the drinks in the refrigerator, fruit and coffee. Lovely walk to a beach at the end of the road. Great value and we would stay with them again.
The host canceled this reservation 4 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Glenn and Mary's place is very welcoming and clean. Glenn and Mary are friendly and helpful, but give you your space. Their home is in a quiet, historical area with plantation homes. The price is very reasonable and the rooms are very comfortable. The bed and bedding are ultra comfortable making for a wonderful night's sleep after busy days. We strongly recommend Glenn and Mary's place!

Mary's place is the place you want to be staying when the airline loses your luggage, she has fully stocked her rental with just about anything you need. Though it is an old plantation era home the space is freshly painted, nicely decorated, and quite comfortable. The neighborhood holds a secret which alone is reason to stay there. Glenn and Mary have lots of local knowledge to share, and Mary can give you an education in local hula. Light sleepers note there are barking dogs and crowing roosters in the neighborhood.
Great location for hikers and nature lovers. Room is perfectly equipped also for longer stays. Mary and Glenn were very kind and helpful.
Definitely recommend to others.

Such a nice comfortable, clean and peaceful home.. Mary has lovely gardens and the room decor of Hawaii, along with special touches and just about any amenity was thought of and provided. Highly recommend !

Glenn and Mary were great hosts!  Their home is located just outside of Hilo and is a quick five minute drive into town.  Their rental space is private with a separate entrance which makes it easy to come and go as you please.  We would happily stay again if our travels bring us back to the Hilo area in the future!

Glenn and Mary’s place is beautiful, excellently appointed and maintained.  They have thought of absolutely everything a guest might want or need.  The bed is the most comfortable bed I have slept in over the course of many Airbnb stays.  It rained hard several of the days we were there, but the sound of the rain was enchanting and was lovely to watch as well.  There is a beautiful scenic walk down to the beach at the end of the street.  The location is just about 10 minutes out of Hilo on the way north to Honokaa and Waipio Valley, close to many waterfalls, botanical gardens and ziplines!  I could imagine relaxing here for days on end and hope to come back to do just that!

Mary's and Glenn's room feels more like a 1 br apartment. Lots of space, spotless clean, and nicely decorated with a small kitchenette to have breakfast and a private bath.  Mahalo for the bread and honey and butter and tea and coffee and all the small details in the kitchenette and bathroom that made our short stay super comfortable and convenient. Communication and check-in were very smooth and Mary pointed us to a few sights near-by for a rainy day. Highly recommended hosts. Thanks again!

Loved this place!!  Glenn and Mary thought if everything — forgot something? They probably have it.  Want to snorkel but need mask and fins...yep, beach towel...of course.  Forgot mouthwash or your shaver...you guessed it.  The neighborhood is quiet, has its own little beach, and is close to hilo for eats etc... but also just a few minutes to the botanical garden.

We really loved staying with Mary and Glenn! It’s calm and peaceful place very close to Hilo (just about 5min drive). We liked to have morning coffee on a comfy porch, small beach was just 5 min walking.
Mary gave us very good recomendations and overall it was pleasant to chat.
Thank you Mary and Glenn for having us! and special thanks for coffee and muffins!

Our two night stays at Glenn and Mary's were so lovely and highly recommended.  They have more than everything needed for us to stay comfortable.  The room is very clean and decorated in lovely Hawaiian style.  We also enjoyed walking to the cozy beach very close from the house and have relaxing personal beach time.  Mary was very helpful in giving us necessary information around the area and Hilo.  If you are spending time in Hilo side of the island, this place is worthy staying!

There should be a rating "EXCEPTIONAL" for places way above 5 stars, as this one is. Mary and Glenn have created "home away from home" for a tired traveler. Not only that the place is sparkling clean, having a comfort level of the highest rated hotels, king-size bed I only wish I had at home, kitchenette with everything you need even if you decide to move-in full time, bathroom with everything "in case you forgot" and much, much more. Touches like cold water and juices in the fridge, as well as your coffee cream and butter, Keurig coffee maker with the best coffees to choose from, fresh Kona coffee with the grinder for the freshest flavour, chocolate candies for the sweet tooth attack, varieties of teas to choose from, honey and any other sweetener to choose from for the picky ones are there, as well as the assortment of DVDs, books, cards, maps, beach towel, instructions for the places to see and things to taste and then there are your kindest of the kind hosts and their puppies they saved from the pond. Words escape me to describe how they made us feel and how happy we were to find their place on the last night of our long stay in Hawaii when all you need is a good rest for the night of travel ahead. Our hosts were wonderful enough and let us stay till 6pm which was something we didn't even dream of getting as our flight was the late one. Their cutest dogs are there to welcome you , but will not bug you if you are not a dog person.  The greatest regret we have is that we didn't discover this home for the whole week were staying in Hilo on the beginning of our trip. It would have been just the best thing, but we will come back and sure enough we will let everyone know about  Glenn and Mary. The location could not be better.. a walk away from the beach, but close enough to downtown Hilo and a breeze to access. Literally minutes drive on away from all the important places to see in Hilo, yet centrally located to all the sites to visit on the north side of the east coast as well as those south of Hilo and the Volcano National Park. If you are planning on staying and exploring the incredible beauty of the east side of Big Island, feel lucky if you are reading this and finding your dates available on Glenn and Mary's calendar. I can't recommend these hosts and their home enough. Thank you again for your exceptional kindness and the home you opened to complete strangers with your whole heart!

What a nice place! Everything is affectionately furnished and decorated. We only arrived late in the evening and had to leave early in the morning but we felt sad to leave. Staying a bit longer would definitely been great. You will find EVERYTHING you might need. Coffee, honey, tooth brush ... EVERYTHING. Glenn's and Mary's house is a place to feel comfortable.

We had a wonderful stay at Glenn and Mary’s! The home is a wonderfully restored plantation era building. The room is spacious, beautifully decorated with so many delightful little surprises and thoughtful touches like fresh water in lovely glass bottles, his and her robes in the bathroom, a great assortment of teas and much more. Private and special and so close to Hilo. Loved the black sand beach within walking distance down the street. Mary was thoughtful and helpful and respectful of our privacy. Would definitely stay here again.
整个旅程最惊艳的一处,host人超棒,完美!
Easy to find, helpful hosts, very clean space, comfy bed, very nice bathroom, complimentary drinks and a wide range of toiletries in case you forgot something. Would definitely stay again.
Great, super comfortable room & bathroom with private entrance. Would stay here again without hesitation!
A

Glenn & Mary’s place was perfect for our one night stay in Hilo. It was close enough to downtown Hilo (about a 7 minute drive), but also far enough to enjoy nature. The adorable puppies were a great bonus! Would definitely recommend to friends traveling through Hilo

The house is SUPER pretty. Very neat and nice garden. Dogs and cat are very friendly, playful and adorable. We lived in the same house and got our private room and restroom.
They have EVERYTHING. Toiletries, towels, microwave, 4 jugs of water ready to drink, some snacks, books, movies, parking space for car, etc...and a very helpful guidebook with their favorite restaurants and recommended activities. Best of all, they a positive aura about them. Glen and Mary — Thank you ❤️
Propre avec tout ce que vous pouvez avoir besoin (café, sucre, crème à café, thé, pâte à dent, ...) et environ 15-20 minutes de l’aéroport.

Glenn and Mary's place was more than we expected.  If you forgot anything, do not worry it is provided.  The location is close to town.  Glenn and Mary will respond to any questions that you may have quickly.  I would recommend this Air BnB Host to everyone who is going to Hilo.  Thank you Mary and Glenn!

Warm hosts that hit the balance of also respecting your space. Lots of nice touches, absolutely everything you could think of to be comfortable and an extremely comfortable bed. I will stay here again.

Awesome hosts
Super nice place

The house of Mary and Glenn is the perfect hideaway after s long day hiking around. It is super well located outside Hilo. You will find everything you need and even more! The room is spacious and the king size bed was the best we slept in on the Big Island. We liked it so much that we stayed for an extra night. Mary et Glenn sont des hôtes vraiment respectueux et très sympas!
집이 매우 깨끗하고 잘 꾸며져 있습니다. 아주머니가 신경써서 정원을 가꾼 느낌입니다. 다만 제가 갔을 때 비가 많이 와서 모기가 좀 있었습니다. 화장실도 널찍하고 여유롭게 잘 썼습니다. 강아지는 작고 매우 귀엽습니다.

Glenn & Mary are amazing hosts. They were accommodating enough to let us check-in late in the night. The room itself is really good. _HIGH_ ceilings, a huge bed. The neat little kitchenette was stocked with everything we would need. We made breakfast everyday and had tea in the mornings - haha. The room has its own entrance and a private bathroom (fully stocked). They have insect repellents to used in case someone wants to hike to this nearby beach too. Glenn & Mary have written up things to see and do in a binder that is kept on the side table. Quite a lot of information it had. We followed a couple of them - Hilo Farmer's Market and Rainbow Falls. What is amazing is that Glenn & Mary have slowly but surely remodeled and fixed the whole house themselves. Kudos! Thanks for having us.
Mary and Glenn are great hosts! The apartment was very clean and cozy,provided with amenities you would never thought you needed! Thank you guys for an amazing stay!
Perfect distance from downtown Hilo. The place itself was very cozy and clean. They provide amenities for things you forget. The host was very responsive. Definitely would stay again.
Comfortable space, nice old house lovingly restored to better than new. Beautiful scenic drive to get to location. Small fridge and hot water maker for tea and coffee.
We had a great stay at Glenn and Mary’s house, they are great hosts! The room is clean, calm and very nice:) we had everything we needed, i recommend :)

What a sweet spot! Clean, neat, organized. I loved the tiny kitchen nook, with cold water, great coffee, mini moos! The room is separate from the rest of the house, with a very lovely bathroom. It’s clear that the host pays attention to details. The bed is very comfortable.  The garden is lovely. I would certainly  stay here again!

Fantastic stay in a beautiful location. Glen and Mary are wonderful hosts. We had a long chat and they were happy to answer all our questions about the island. 
Everything you need is in your room, and I mean everything. Would definitely recommend to anyone wanting a nice comfy stay on the big island, Hilo side.

We only stayed one night and it was really great ! Glenn and Mary are very reactive so the communication was perfect. The room is big and clean with little touch of attention everywhere. We only saw Mary and she was very nice. The room is very close to Hilo. We really enjoyed coming here and would definitely come back. Thanks again :)

My parents stayed here and were very happy with everything. Exactly as described. 
Very cosy and great value. They also loved having the pets around.

We stayed at Glenn and Mary’s place for one night and it was absolutely an enjoyable experience. We arrived late and they kindly left lights on the driveway  for us so we can easily self check-in at night. The room was clean and private, with thoughtful touches such as beverages in the mini fridge and drinking water for coffee or tea, or the local travel & dining tips. We didn’t meet them in person but from the messages and the settings of the space we can feel that they really care for their guests. We will definitely stay here again if we are back in the area.
Le séjour chez Glenn et Mary a été parfait. Petites attentions, respect de l'intimité et amabilité ont fait de notre escale à Hilo un moment très agrérable. Je recommande !

The Hale Melia is a besutiful room comfortable and very nice in Hawaii style decorated, the bathroom is big and with all facilities, easy to find and to drive anywhere in Hawaii Island, I enjoyed the flowers in garden and the nice dogs!
This is a gem!

This is a lovely, quaint room with a comfortable bed and high ceilings. There is a pretty ceiling fan, a kitchenette and a nice bathroom. Mary & Glenn have thought of everything. They have multiple toiletries, bug spray, and guide books along with water, juices, coffee, tea cream and sugar etc. Mary responded quickly to all my texts and let me check in a few hours early. She also gave me lots of good tips on beautiful drives and good snorkeling in the area. Her place is close to Hilo and several beautiful waterfalls. The bird & frogs sounds at night were amazing. She has high quality towels, bathrobes and slippers. For the price this is an incredible value.

We loved our 3 night stay at Glenn & Mary's condo. They are very friendly and helpful hosts. The condo is very neat and has everything you needed and also extras such as a map with tips and a map with a beach walkway. The bathroom was fully equipped with all toiletries. It was nice chatting with Glenn and Mary. Great value for the money. Mahalo :-)

If you’re looking for an authentically homey Hawaiian oasis dedicated to quietude and lush peacefulness, this is the spot! The room and private bathroom were immaculately clean and so thoughtfully decorated.  The hosts are so responsive and sweet, very genuine and full of aloha. I’m still blown away by the immense amount of amenities that were available to guests in the room! From the tea to the dental floss, they provide everything that you need! Highly recommend this lovely abode!
great location on the Hilo side, great hosts!

We had a great stay here. We only met Mary but she was quite friendly and helpful. The location was very convenient – just minutes outside Hilo in a tranquil neighborhood. The space was perfect for us: separate entrance from the main house with our own kitchenette and very lovely private bathroom. Huge, comfy bed. So many thoughtful touches really made an impression on us. Hosts were available for any help but gave us total privacy. We only spent 1 night here but wished we'd had longer. Lovely space, definitely recommended.
This place was over and above expectations, great place for a single traveller. Lots of tips, books, coffees, teas, toiletries. Accommodating hosts.
amazing place they provide you with everything you can need in your stay. we highly recommend glenn and marys place

A spot in the jungle! The studio-like setup was very spacious with little extras for us in both the kitchenette and the bathroom, like Kona coffee beans, cold juice, and pretty much every toiletry you could forget.  The room itself had great lighting and the bed was comfy.  The front yard is absolutely lush and gorgeous and full of green gecko friends. It's a little bit of a drive to get to downtown Hilo (~10-15min), but I wanted to stay here because it was more in the forest.  The walk down to the black sand beach was beautiful and we had the beach to ourselves to admire when we went went exploring.  This is a great place to stay.

This space is perfect for anyone staying in Hilo and the location was awesome. It’s close to town and right off the highway so it was easy to get to. The amenities were so well thought after and the bed and space was clean and comfortable. Mary was a sweetheart and always willing to give us some tips on we’re to go or try. We loved the doggy greeting squad as we missed our own.  This place is a perfect home away from home for a week on the big island. Highly recommend.

Glenn and Mary's place is in a superb location. Very close to Hilo but in a small neighborhood with a more relaxed country feel. Also walking distance to a really sweet beach. The place was super clean, stylish, peaceful and relaxing. Glenn and Mary are very kind, gracious people.

The place is charming with adorable decorative touches and alot of privacy. The bed was super comfy and cozy.  I loved that they provided so many things for a traveler so if you forgot anything it would be there for you. Also there is a walk down to the beach that they described perfectly on how to get there and what to expect, really great.

At Glenn and Mary’s place, you can really feel the peaceful of the place! There’s a lot of plants everywhere and the attention put in every detail makes this place unique! We loved our stay there and would recommend it to everyone!

We had a great stay at Glen and Mary’s. Right from reserving through communication just before our trip to the actual place and meeting them etc were all great. Such great attention to detail. Nice private space in a charming old house with nicely updated bathrooms and very well appointed. The bedroom also has nice little nooks set up with a little fridge and other small utilities. Overall a lovely place to stay.

A few mins away from Downtown Hilo. If you walk down from their place, there is a beach. The room felt more like a studio with its own access and private bath. The bath is remodel with a full size stand alone shower. I would definitely stay here again.

We had a lovely stay at Glenn and Mary’s. The room is exactly as described, we slept so well! The bathroom is great, really new and with everything you might need. There was also delicious coffee in the room. The porch is wonderful and there is a private beach you can access. Communication with the hosts was really fast and fluid. They waited for us to show us the room and give us some tips on local food and sightseeing. The location is really convenient to explore the Volcano’s park, Hilo and the west coast. I absolutely recommend this place and the hosts!
A great and welcoming place, Mary is a great landlord, very recommended! If there is still a chance to stay again

THis is a most beautiful refurbished old plantation house with every imaginable detail well taken care of -- you might as well be at a five star hotel. Mary and Glenn wonderful and most helpful hosts. Located in the gorgeous Hilo coast, you can walk to the shore and to the waterfalls, see the old mill ruins, walk to the plantation museum run by wayne subica across the road. A short drive to Hilo and an easy drive to Laupahoehoe and Honokaa. Recommend!
Lovely place with everything!

Loved, loved this place!! A quiet, comfortable place to stay at the end of long days of site seeing. So clean and everything you could need for your stay; toiletries, bath robes, beach towels, coffee maker and a couple of cute dogs and a sweet old cat. Definitely recommend!!

We loved Glenn and Mary and their lovely place!  They just remodeled their bathroom and it is beautiful.   Mary met us and showed us around the apartment.  We so appreciated the wonderful touches that Mary had,  cold water and drinks in the fridge, and extra toiletries.  They also had a binder with local info which was very helpful.  Glenn even helped us repair a tear in a car seat.  Glenn and Mary were wonderful hosts.
It`s a Beautiful place to stay. The Room  and Bathroom were immaculately clean an so thoughtfully decorated.

Glenn and Mary have thought of everything for their Airbnb. The kitchenette was extremely well stocked, it has everything you need and more. The bathroom is remodeled and the decorative touches are lovely and fun. The bed is large and comfy. Their place makes you feel like you’re truly on vacation! Communication was quick and easy. We arrived late and in the dark and the step by step check-in instructions were incredibly helpful. Wish we stayed longer!

Logement très très bien Équipé avec tout le confort nécessaire. Petit coin cuisine, salle de bain très bien fournie. Très propre. Nous avons été accueillies par Mary qui n’a pas hésité à nous donner des conseils et bonnes adresses. Je recommande vivement.

Glenn and Mary have a beautiful home.  It has high ceilings and it’s immaculate.  The room is well decorated and the bathroom is beautiful.  Everything you could possibly need is provided.  They have excellent towels and a private entrance.  Great location just north of Hilo.  We want to come back.  Communication between hosts is easy and prompt.
Abosolutely a very lovely place to stay. There are so may Details made with love! Very good located for all destinations on the east coast of big island. We will definitely recommend this place!

Sehr sauber und detailreich eingerichtet.
Sehr viele Extras, wie Kaffee und Limonade und Kosmetik Artikel.
Sehr freundliches Paar.

It is such an amazing place to stay. The location is prefect, near beach and airport as well. Great Amenities! Glenn and Mary are very nice and responsive. Wonderful experience! I will highly recommend this place to everyone while visiting Hilo.
Very nice, clean, and comfortable space.  Super peaceful location.  I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay.. I highly recommend it and I would definitely stay there again.

Glenn and Mary’s place was very nice and clean. The room is well decorated with all the Hawaii touches. The room has its private entrance and bathroom to use. Very convenient. Great location, close to downtown Hilo. Also there is a little nice beach walk there, feel like a private adventure to see the old sugar mill, black sand and the jungle, must check out! Mary was very friendly, we had a great time staying there!

Glenn and Mary's blew us away! They provide so many little touches that made our stay incredible. There's a little kitchenette with a microwave, fridge, and coffee maker, and there's all the dishes you'll need for a longer stay (we stayed for six nights). There's a BBQ outside that we used to make simple meals, and the bathroom is very nice with a lovely big shower and they even provide comfy housecoats! The bed is very comfortable, there's cable TV/loads of DVDs to pick from, and there's a lovely deck with chairs out on it to enjoy the sounds of nature. 

We loved our stay here and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the Big Island!

Glenn and Mary's place had everything I needed. There was coffee and juice provided and the room was very comfortable. There's a really nice beach down the road that was completely empty, and hilo is less than 10 minutes away by car. I would definitely stay again.

Glenn and Mary's place is in a fantastic location!  Just outside of Hilo, it's away from congestion, but close enough to everything you'd need such as dining and shopping.  There is a beach a short walk from the place, but be prepared to spray up with Off or some other insect repellent.  At night, the coqui frogs will put on a serenade for you, which will last until the break of dawn.  We didn't mind; when we got back to Kansas, we were anticipating them starting up at sundown.  If we're ever back in Hilo, we'd definitely try to stay here again.
Glenn and Mary are wonderful. I enjoyed the room, location, beautiful private beach down the street, and the kitchenette.

The place was great, nice and quiet. Mary was hospitable and helped us check in. They have a very cute dog name Phoebe. They provided many DVDs for you if you happened to get bored. Will come back again!

We loved Glenn and Mary's place! We had complete privacy with our own separate space and there were several nice touches like a small kitchenette stocked with honey, tea, etc. The location is very central and is close to downtown Hilo as well as Akaka Falls and Hawaii Tropical Botanical Garden. Would stay again and definitely recommend to others!
We stayed one night passing through the area, it was great! Very comfortable bed, nice bathroom.

This is the best Airbnb we have ever stayed at. They have everything you could possibly need to have a comfortable stay. They are also such nice people. The space is beautiful, the bed is so comfortable, and the amount of thought they have put into providing local tips is a bous.   Also, the coffee they have is so delicious . The location is beautiful and we loved the beach walk they recommended.

We highly recommend you book a stay at this 5 Star Airbnb 

Mahalo nui loa Glenn and Mary
Great spot!  About a 10 minute drive to Hilo. I really loved the walk to the beach. Very comfortable bed and GREAT shower.
Clean, cozy and stylish room with so many thoughtful amenities. Very nice location close to Hilo and a beautiful hike to the beach and the owners are helpful and very nice. Excellent place to stay.
Stylish hideaway this place was a gem!

The place is amazing! Room is very comfortable and clean. It has private entrance and you have your all space just for you. There are all amenities you can need in the room - coffee maker, fridge, microwave, glasses and plates. Nice terrace where you can have breakfast. Recommend to everybody!
Nicely renovated older sugar plantation home. Loved the newly done bathroom! Comfortable and pleasant.

It was a pleasure to stay at Mary and Glenn`s house. They were so helpful when i needed. So beautiful room and the bathroom is so  speciel.
I can highly recommend to stay at there place.
Thank you Mary for your hospitality

We arrived late and Glenn and Mary made sure we knew everything we needed to know to make checking in painless at 1am. The room was spotless and perfectly ready for us and on top of that there were fresh flowers in the room from the garden. Everything we could possibly need was in the room, directions for anything unfamiliar and thoughtful things like cold water in the fridge and extra toiletries in the bathroom not to mention the fresh flowers. Glenn and Mary are as available as you need them to be and very helpful and friendly. The location was perfect for us, Hilo has much more charm than Kona and still has many things to do and see. The Saturday farmers market in Hilo, the botanical garden and the beautiful eastern coast to name a few. If you're looking for a quiet, lush place to relax and resorts and crowds aren't your thing the Hilo side of the island is much better. Such a wonderful stay with wonderful hosts!

The room was more than neat and Mary and Glenn so welcoming. You will get fresh flowers in the amazing bathroom and great tips to visit the area. The small walk to the private beach is fantastic.  It's ideally located and we highlty recommand the room : really worth the price for a very comfy stay.

We had such a comfortable stay at Glenn and Mary's place! The bed was extremely comfortable, the rainfall shower head was awesome, and they had really thought of everything a traveler could possibly need. I would definitely stay here again, and recommend to others.

We really enjoy the time in this house.
There are many tropical plants here. The yard is quiet and beautiful. The room is very clean. Everything is perfact. We hope we can stay here again.
玛丽的房子非常好找,按照导航即可｡房间是单独的侧房,里面一应俱全,备用品应有尽有,有点酒店的感觉但是却又很温馨!交通方便,附近可以去彩虹瀑布和莉莉乌库拉尼花园都很近!在大岛物价普遍偏高的情况下,玛丽的房子五星推荐!

We had a great stay with Glenn and Mary. Unfortunately, it was only for one night!  Many thoughtful touches made a great stay even better. The weather changed our plans for the day and Mary was nice enoughto let us check in early. I can't recommend this airbnb enough!
房間乾淨且佈置可愛,床又大又舒適,值得推薦!

name: Single Room(No Window)
summary: All our rooms tidy n clean,free wifi,air-cindition,shower room,24h hot water,free luggage
space: 房間適合公幹或過境旅客｡

host.host_about:
我是一個熱情好客的人,歡迎與來自世界各地的人交流｡這個賓館是我用心裝修整理的,地理位置優越,臨近旺角地鐵站,購物方便,還有專門巴士去各處的主題公園｡藉助這個機會,更能為客人介紹香港的文化與人情味｡ 
I am the manager of Amigo Inn , my name is Jim, we have 23 rooms , so I guess  one of my rooms can fit your budget
Our inn located  in city center , MONGKOK where is most busiest area n transportation center to any where in hk, as u may know
  Subway/Mtr ---MONGKOK mtr n find the exit E2 which is the nearest exit to my hostel
We also provide discounted theme park  ticket like Disney park , ocean park n peak tram

address.street: 旺角, 九龍, Hong Kong

reviews.comments: 位置很好!交通方便!房东很热情!很不好意思因为我个人问题给房东添了麻烦,再次感谢您!
It was clean and quiet.

The location of Jim's place is super. Access to the room on 4th floor not so easy but once in the room all facilities work fine. Jim was very helpful staying up late to receive me (2am+) and gave useful local tips and support.
Decent place with decent accommodations but in a great location, close to the MTRs. The place was a bit smaller than expected but the price is reasonable.

Just a good place where you get what you paid for PLUS the host Jim.
Placement is great in the street parallel to famous Fa Yuenstreet
While I used the place during a period still not too hot it was great. Wouldn't book it hough during the hot and high humidity period as only the room has aircon and steps and coorridors are without

Had an enjoyable 5 days stay at this hostel. The room is clean and the location is excellent. Definitely made my holiday here in Hong Kong a smooth and easy one. Thank You Jim for being such a great host.

房源不錯,位置在旺角地鐵站附近,價錢合理
再次的謝謝你!
地段不错
地段很好,性价比很高
Good location, close to MTR. Good value for money. Owner is very helpful. Quick response to requests. I can recommend this place.
Good location on mong kok sports shoes street, easy to MTR
worth to stay
房间位置非常好 房东也很贴心一直提醒及确认路线 位置很方便 离旺角站很近 而且还帮忙拿行李 房间很舒适 干净 下次来还会选择这里

name: Chelsea NYC luxury 2 bed/2 bath, garden apt
summary: Enjoy a private dwelling, access the home through your private garden, where the house is strategically located away from the busy street, ensuring complete privacy. Offering 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms it is ideal setup for 2 couples. With indoor just over 1000 sq ft and  outdoor amazing terrace and gardens, you will be able to relax and unwind after a long day in the city.
space: The harmonious conjugation of an artistic interior with functionality. The exact proportion between classical New York and the most modern, zippy city in the world. This apartment is located in one of the most conveniently located streets in Chelsea, at the border of Greenwich Village and Chelsea. It is an oasis in the city, featuring a luscious private front garden, with over 1000 sq feet of indoor living and a huge private terrace. Surrounded by historic buildings, the finest restaurants and best boutiques. This is your home, a secret, elegant and contemporary designer house, in the shelter of the corner from 7th Avenue and steps away from Lower 5th avenue. The point of balance between classicism and design, between the buzz of the Big Apple and the relaxing warmth of a lounging on a comfortable sofa. The ideal romantic getaway, shopping trip, night-time city experience or just to live among celebrities. LIVING ROOM:  The living room is beautifully designed with a mix of antiques and
description: Enjoy a private dwelling, access the home through your private garden, where the house is strategically located away from the busy street, ensuring complete privacy. Offering 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms it is ideal setup for 2 couples. With indoor just over 1000 sq ft and  outdoor amazing terrace and gardens, you will be able to relax and unwind after a long day in the city. The harmonious conjugation of an artistic interior with functionality. The exact proportion between classical New York and the most modern, zippy city in the world.
