Diogo's apartment is great with stunning view at the city of Porto and the river Douro.
The reception (arranged by his father) was great and easy.
If you come by car parking was free and nearby and 24hrs accesible.
Supermarket for groceries etc. 15 min walking or 5 min by car.
Anything you wish during a stay was there and the apartment was very clean.
I can recommend this apartment to anyone who wish to stay nearby the citycentre with great views over the city of Porto.
We had a pleasent visit! Clean modern apartment. Very close to all the port wine cellars. Recommended

WOW! Si vous louez cet appartement, vous tomberez dans la catégorie des gens chanceux. La première chose que vous réaliserez c'est que c'est très facile de se stationner dans le stationnement privé qui se situe à quelques pas. Par la suite cest l'incroyable vue sur Porto; définitivement la plus belle vue de tout notre voyage au Portugal. Ensuite, vous rencontrerez le charmant José : super sympathique! Par la suite, en montant à l'appartement vous réaliserez que ce que vous aviez vu sur les photos est exact : impeccable, bien équipé (vaisselle, ustensile, laveuse, 2 salles de bain avec savon et shampoing dans la douche, etc.) grand, et vue extraordinaire par les fenêtres des chambres. Une petite surprise vous attendra. 10 minutes à pieds et vous êtes l'autre côté du pont, à Porto même. N'attendez surtout pas avant de louer! Si je retourne à Porto, je retournerai au Magic Escape 3 sans aucun doute. Plaira même aux plus difficiles! <3

Look no further! Location! Location! Location! Walking distance to the boardwalk, the bridge and the wineries.  Large, clean place with the most amazing views of Porto, plus the added bonus of your own private balcony! Pictures don’t do it justice, must see to believe. The host was the nicest and easiest to work with. Would definitely come back here!
Very clean and beautiful appartment. Amazing view on Porto. Well located, would come back anytime!

El piso está muy bien , todo reformado y muy limpio . Los anfitriones muy atentos con respuestas a todas nuestras preguntas . La localización buenísima para visitar Oporto 
Altamente recomendable

We really hope to stay here again. The balcony view is much better than in pics, the apartment is located in a walking distance to the banks of river, funicular and city tour buses. It's great value for money.

We stayed here for 8 nights and were very pleased indeed with our choice. In fact the experience could not have been better. The apartment was spotlessly clean and well equipped. It must have one of the best views in the whole of the city, looking across the river to the old part of Porto. Jose gave us a  very warm welcome and was very helpful throughout the stay. If you are thinking of booking definitely do it, you won't be disappointed!! It's just a 5 minute walk (uphill) to the very convenient light rail (one stop into town), or a short walk across the bridge, a wonderful experience in itself.

Our stay at Diogo’s place was the best of many during our two weeks in Portugal. The host was able to arrange for an extra parking spot which was a huge benefit for our group travelling in two vehicles. We were greeted at the door and shown to the nearby car park where the host proceeded to help us with our bags up to the third floor apartment. Entrance to the building and room are through a custom code so no worry about keys. We were also treated to a bottle of port and Portuguese tarts upon our arrival. The apartment was perfect. They thought of everything and it was all brand new and sparkling clean. The two bathrooms were a huge plus for our large group. The only thing better was the view of Porto from the bedroom windows and the street below. When we next visit Porto we will definitely try to stay here again!
limpieza y ubicacion

Os comentários positivos são plenamente justificáveis. O apartamento é muito agradável, limpo, com todos os utensílios necessários. Só seria melhor se a máquina de lavar roupas fosse também secadora. Não é recomendado para pessoas com dificuldade de mobilidade, pois são 47 degraus a subir. A vista é de tirar o fôlego e o José muito gentil. Recomendamos demais!

He was great host ever! We had some problem with parking bill and dont know how to solve it. He was really helpful in everyway. The house was really clean, warm, and cozy. And he gave us welcome Nata and Portwine. It was great. My family really appreciate his kindness. I highly recommand it.

Emplacement idéal, hôtes très attentionnés, une vue imprenable sur le douro et la ville. Un parking gratuit sécurisé. Sans hésiter une adresse à conseiller. Tous les services fournis pour des enfants en bas âge comme nous (3 ans et 10mois)

We were not able to wish for a better place to stay in Porto. Everything was done with attention to detail and thinking about the comfort of people who are going to stay in the apartment. Views from the apartment's  balcony are stunning and cannot be forgotten for many months to come.  Can be recommended to everybody , without having any second thoughts.
Diogo et José nous ont très bien accueilli. Ils sont très réactifs. L'appartement est très propre et bien situé, à proximité des caves à Porto de Gaïa. Superbe expérience!!

Tivemos uma receptividade maravilhosa, cheia de dicas e mimos. A vista do apartamento é inacreditável e a localização perfeita, para caminhar, comodidades de restaurantes e mercado por perto. Ficamos muito felizes com este apartamento.
Recomendamos para todos!
Lovely place, great location, super host
Everything was so perfect that even if you'd asked me to find just anything wrong, I doubt I have an answer! Thanks, Diogo, for making such lovely appartments real!

Centraal gelegen appartement met 2 slaapkamers en 2 badkamers.
Aan een doorgaande weg gelegen waardoor je op de slaapkamers geluidsoverlast van verkeer hebt. 
Warm ontvangst met port en iets lekkers! 
Voor tips van omgeving en goede restaurants moet je zelf de uitgedeelde stadskaart en eventueel tripadvisor raadplegen.

Excellent accueil de José, rendez vous sur les lieux sans aucune difficulté Appartement conforme à la présentation, spacieux, adapté aux familles, très proche du centre, accès piéton et transport très proche restauration à proximité.

Fabulous apartment with the best views in Porto. Host was amazing and was always easy to contact and very amenable. 
Apartment was first class. Very clean, bright and comfortable. 
Would highly recommend this apartment and would happily come back.

My wife and I travelled to Porto with our 11 month old.  We were very happy with Diogo and Jose's apartment.  Jose greeted us at the front of the building and helped us move into the apartment.  He was incredibly friendly and helpful offering us directions and recommendations for restaurants and all the essentials in the neighborhood.  The apartment is a short walk over the bridge into Porto and the views of the river and city are spectacular.  It was everything we could have asked for and would highly recommend it to anyone, as well as those traveling with a young one.

We stayed in the 3rd floor apartment, and the view of Porto across the river from the bedroom balcony is simply sensational.

The apartment itself is spacious and well equipped for longer stays. Ideal for two couples, with 2 separate bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a sofabed in the living room if you want to fit another couple in. Everything was spotlessly clean on arrival. Good linen and comfortable beds.

The location is ideal for exploring Porto and Vila Nova de Gaia on foot, and there are shops, bars, restaurants and Port tours nearby.

This was our first trip to Porto and probably the nicest Airbnb stay we have ever had.  The apartment was even more beautiful than the pictures.  This was a last minute (the night before) reservation and Diogo was fast and accurate with all communications.  We actually have never stayed at an Airbnb with a designation of  "SuperHost."  We were spoiled and may never book another without the SuperHost label!  

We were greeted by the ever smiling Jose when we exited our taxi at the front door.  He helped us up to our amazing apartment and showed us around the place.  Everything from furnishings to the artwork on the walls was perfect.  The apartment is modern and has all the amenities you would ever need  for a 3 day weekend stay or longer!  

The view, the view, the view!   We sat on the balcony with the plate of Pastel de Nata and a bottle of Port, both graciously left as a welcome gift on the dining room table for us.  We ate the pasties and drank the wine while soaking in the amazing view!

The entire weekend was amazing!  Thank you Diogo and Jose for your hospitality and offering such a beautiful apartment to us!  Obrigado!

Super netter Vermieter; hat uns sehr viele gute Tipps gegeben für Essen, Besichtigungen, Benutzung öffentlicher Verkehrsmittel, ... und auch dafür gesorgt, dass wir unsere Flugtickets ausgedruckt bekamen.
Als wir nach einer Kaffeemaschine gefragt haben außer der Pad-Maschine war 10 Minuten später eine Kaffeemaschine da.

The apartment was spotless & very well equipped. Two bathrooms is a great help for a party of three adult females.  The view of the River Douro is gorgeous especially at night. Host Josè could not have been more helpful.
He answered every question promptly & ordered the taxi for our return to the airport.

Exception apartment with fantastic view of the city of Porto, yet still close (5 minutes walk) to the old town. The apartment is very stylish but on the 3rd floor with no elevator.  It has a full complement of amenities. Jose, the host is very receptive, informative and responsive, indeed a “Super Host”.

Highly recommended.

El alojamiento es fantástico, muy bien ubicado, puedes llegar caminando al centro histórico.
La atención al recibirnos fue excelente.
Volvería de nuevo .
A+++++ one of the best Airbnb experiences we've had. Best place possible in Porto with an amazing of the river and old-town. Incredible hospitality.
L’appartement est 100% conforme à la description! Bien localisé pour partir explorer Porto à pied.

Perfecte uitvalsbasis voor een bezoek aan Porto. Het uitzicht is spectaculair.  De host is uiterst vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Het appartement is voorzien van alle benodigdheden en zeer proper. Parkeerplaats is zeker een plus.
Excelente localização. Vista para o Douro/Cais da Ribeira insuperável. Próximo dos melhores pontos turísticos do Porto. Muito próximo do metro.

Hands down one of the best apartments I've ever stayed at. The view was to die for. The apartment was clean and perfect for our party of 4 and my 10 month old. Walking distance to everything. Diogo had port wine and pasteis de nata waiting for us. Will definitely stay here again!

Superb! Great appartment, great location, great hosts! Close to everything, great view. May be 
a little bit noisy because of it's  central location. Evetything is availble by walk. We enjoyed very much our staying. Highly recommended!

Certainement un des meilleurs endroits où habiter pour visiter Porto tellement la vue depuis le balcon est MAGNIFIQUE ! L'appartement est confortable et très propre et l'accueil excellent! On recommande!

This spot is 5* and more and Diogo and Jose were amazing hosts! The pictures don’t do justice to how fantastic it is! It is large and very very clean with special touches throughout the apartment. From the pasteis de nata and port wine to welcome us to the clothes pins to a rack to hang dry your clothes on the hosts have thought of every detail. The place was large and spacious for our family and the kids loved it! The view is again way way better than the pictures show and it’s location on this side of the river with steps down to the waterfront and port caves is just perfect. Thank you again for an amazing stay!
Very nice place with a great view. Everything was as described and expected. Thank you!

It was an amazing place for us to stay.  Diego’s extra care made our stay special and extremely comfortable.  The place is located in great spot, and Diego gave us lots of information, which was helpful for me and me elderly parents in particular.  Thanks for your warm heart and smile, Diego.

Wir hatten ein Apartment zur Straße raus. Die Schlafzimmer sind sehr geräumig, die Innenausstattung der Wohnung sehr modern. Küche mit Kühlschrank und Herdplatte ist bei Bedarf vorhanden; nur Gewürze, Öl oder ähnliches fehlte. 
Großer Pluspunkt ist die zentrale Lage (vielleicht 200 Meter zur Ponte Dom Luis). Man ist mittendrin, ohne direkt im touristischeren Getümmel zu sein. Der Blick von den Balkonen aus (wir hatten die Wohnung in der obersten Etage) ist schlicht atemberaubend. Besser geht es wohl nicht.
Vis-a-vis führt eine Treppe zu einschlägigen Kaffees und Restaurants. Ein Supermarkt ist leider nicht direkt um die Ecke. Ebenfalls hervorzuheben ist der kostenlose Parkplatz in einer ansonsten von Parkplätzen nicht gesegneten Gegend. Der Parkplatz ist direkt sehr nah an der Wohnung und wir bewacht. Jose war ein wirklich großartiger Gastgeber, der uns mit unserem Gepäck half und uns sogar ein paar Besichtigungs- und Restauranttipps gab. 
Kleine Kritikpunkte (die wirklich haarspalterisch sind): Die Zimmer ermöglichen einen fantastischen Blick auf Porto, sind allerdings auch sehr laut. Die Straße vor der Wohnung ist der einzige Anfahrtswerk zur Brücke. Da die Scheiben/Wände eher schlecht isoliert sind, ist der Lkw- und Motorradlärm durchgängig wahrnehmbar. Wer diesbezüglich empfindlich ist, könnte ggf. Probleme bekommen. Die vorliegenden Kissen sind etwas hart und eher für Rückenschläfer geeignet.
Aber das sind Kleinigkeiten: Alles in allem ist die Unterkunft sehr zu empfehlen.

Muito Obrigado, Jose!

Great place, great location, beautiful view.  Convenient location to everything.   Parking is nearby, not on premises.   Amenities were all great and the place was very clean.   A great host!   Would definitely come back again!

The location of this apartment is quite ideal. It has a brilliant view of town and it is just minutes away from everything. The only downside that you may find is that if you are easily woken up at night, the road can be a bit noisy (not a problem for me, fortunately). If you’re going by car, you are able to park at the car park just a couple of minutes away (host gives you a card to have free access). There is no parking outside the property, so you won’t be able to unload there. One little thing that happened to us on last day was that the power went, but it was a matter of host pressing a button to have it working again. A lovely pastel de nata and Porto wine was waiting for us as a nice welcome gesture. Overall, very pleasant and highly recommended.

The location and the view of the apartment are perfect. You can reach the old town in a few minutes and nearby there is a charming small, typically Portuguese supermarket and all the famous Port wine cellars. We enyojed every moment.

Such a great place to stay!! The view is amazing. A quick walk down to the waterfront and the bridge over to Porto. Diogo and Jose are excellent hosts. The apartment is spacious, clean and has everything you need!
It’s a wonderful apartment, with incredible views. The view from the front balcony is truly the postcard view of the Douro riverfront.

First of all, we have the "million dollar" Porto view from the balcony off the bedroom.  We travel with kids and everyone has a wonderful time.  House is VRRY homey, CLEAN and comfortable.  Host has amazing amenities including coffee, iron, hanging racks for laundry etc.  Jose was very nice and kind to help with car park, luggages and recommendations.  Our best AirBNB so far.  The only regret is we wish we could have stay longer.  Absolutely 5 star host!  It will be memory of a lifetime!

Thank you for everything, Jose!

We loved staying at the apartment.  The views over Porto were spectacular. The apartment was really comfortably and well decorated with everything you could need for a comfortable stay. We would definitely stay again.

Appartement avec une vue magnifique. Un vrai plaisir. Le centre historique de Porto est à une dizaine de minutes à pied, en traversant le pont Luis 1er. Les caves de Porto sont juste en dessous. Un emplacement exceptionnel. L'appartement en lui même est très grand, très propre, idéal pour 4 personnes, avec deux salles de bain/WC. Il est parfaitement agencé et organisé avec tous les produits nécessaires. Le parking gratuit est à proximité. Bref, pas loin d'un sans faute :-) Juste un tout petit bémol : malgré les fenêtres fermées (possible grâce à la climatisation), la rue se laisse encore entendre un peu. Mais c'est un appartement à recommander chaudement. Si l'occasion se présente, nous y reviendrons sans aucune hésitation. Merci pour tout.
Great location!  Great views of the Douro River and city of Porto. Parking close by.   Special touches from the host as well!

Wow. What a beautiful and well located apartment. It is located close to many restaurants and only a short walk across the bridge to the old town and many attractions. Views from the balcony overlooking the Douro River are great, and the balcony at the rear provides a little serenity after a busy day. We would be very happy to stay in Diogos apartment again.
Best view of Porto, close to everything

This place is worth booking for the view itself; it is stunning! So clean, spacious enough for our group of 4, equipped with everything we needed and in a convenient location that made it easy to get around Gaia and Porto. Many thoughtful touches made pur experience even better. We loved our stay and would highly recommend it!

The house was fantastic!  Beautiful views of Porto.  Excellent location to all activities.  Jose was extremely welcoming and provided information about the area.  Be prepared to walk three flights of stairs.  Jose helped with our bags.  We were running late checking out due to delays with the rental car office and Jose was extremely understanding about our delay.

Nous sommes une famille avec 2 enfants dont 1 bébé et nous avons adoré notre séjour chez Diogo. L'accueil de notre hôte et le stationnement inclus furent grandement appréciés. L'appartement est beau, propre et très bien équipé pour une famille. Il est parfaitement situé à Vila Nova de Gaïa, proche du parc Jardim do Morro, des caves de Porto et de nombreux restaurants. Le point fort de l'appartement est la vue magnifique du balcon sur le Douro, Porto, le pont Dom-Luis et les couchers de soleil!! Par contre les chambres sont situées du côté d'une rue passante et c'est bruyant le soir et la nuit, mais ça ne nous a pas trop incommodé! Je recommande fortement cet appartement pour découvrir Porto!

This is a perfect apartment. Nice view on balcony, nice room with large space and two bathrooms, nice hosts with good service. The apartment is very very clean. The host also serve us a bottle of wine and egg tarts, those are delicious. Besides, he told us so many useful information about sightseeing. And the location is good for going many places by walk. I will live again next time. We had a good time in Porto.

super appartement et vue ! ! 
Tres bien placé dans Porto. 
L'appartement est aussi très propre et possède tout ce qui faut pour passer un bon séjour.
Diogo est très gentil et réactif. Merci encore pour ce séjour.

Diogo’s place is great super clean with modern amenities.  The location is within walking or public trans to all the attractions. Super convenient to port caves.  Diogo carried my luggage upstairs and greeted us with a bottle of port and a map of Porto.  He showed us where everything we needed was on the map!  He’s not just a super host he’s a super duper host!
CLEAN AND EXCELLENT APARTMENT FOR 4 -5 PERSONS WITH TA GREAT VIEW FROM ROOM WINDOWS, LIKE A POSTCARD.

Local extremamente agradável e com a melhor localização do Porto, uma vista maravilhosa de dia e deslumbrante a noite. O apartamento acomoda bem 6 pessoas. Tudo funcionando perfeitamente e tudo muito prático. Recomendamos muito!

Melhor lugar que já estive!
Quanta beleza a localidade nos oferece.
Apartamento de excelente localização e ótima decoração!
Ficamos encantados com tudo envolvido - anfitrião, localização, mobiliário, vista, estacionamento... enfim,  recomendo este imóvel!

excelente (Website hidden by Airbnb) uma vista maravilhosa para o Douro e Porto. muito bem localizado.
apartamento muito limpo e com todo o conforto necessário.
recomendamos a estadia.

El apartamento tiene una vista hermosa y es muy funcional.
José nos recibió muy bien y nos dio recomendaciones para conocer Oporto y nos obsequió una botella de vino de Oporto y pasteles de nata.

Local limpo , sossegado , amplo e com comodidades , tem um cantinho ao lado para tomar seu café da manhã .  Vista espetacular do centro velho e do rio pela  janela e sacada do apartamento. Preço justo com estacionamento ( incluído ) fechado e seguro disponibilizado nas proximidades ( item raríssimo na cidade) .  A poucos minutos a pé dos melhores e badalados  produtores  de Vinho do Porto ( degustação , tour e compras) e ótimos restaurantes (chiques e tb os mais simples) , teleférico e porto do lado de Gaia.  Eu não precisei usar o carro em nenhum momento , preferi pagar 3 a 4 euros para ir ao centro de Uber ( no centro quando você acha estacionamento ,é muito caro) , ou ir ao centro a pé curtindo o trajeto , que é uma atração à parte. Resumindo , é o melhor cantinho para curtir a cidade.

Local bom, Vista Magnifica. Recomendo a qualquer pessoa.
Impecável em todos os aspectos.

Потрясающий вид из окна, лучшее из возможных расположение, в близкой доступности самые яркие достопримечательности, ни секунды не пожалели, что выбрали именно эти апартаменты! Хозяин организовал прибытие на отлично, было место где оставить машину, в квартире есть все необходимое, очень чисто!

Excelente apartamento. 
Localização nota 1000 !!!  
Vale muito a pena se hospedar aqui ! 
O Jose / Diogo sao otimos anfitriões.

포르투 여행에서 가장 완벽한곳. 
지금까지 경험한 비앤비 호스트중 가장 친절했습니다. 
창가에서 보이는 풍경은 어느 곳보다 멋진 풍경입니다. 
다만 같은 건물이 아닌곳에 주차장이 제공되지만 가깝고 쾌적합니다. 
3층에서 지냈는데 엘레베이터가 없어 짐을 옮기는게 조금 어려웠지만 호스트 Jose가 함께 도와주었습니다. 
두번째 포르투 방문이었고 세번째 방문하게되면 꼭 다시 가고 싶은 숙소입니다.

name: Quiet space for one
summary: This  private room has plenty of space in a quiet household. Walk to local buses and village as well as Town centre. You will share the home with a couple over 60 years and but have your own living area. Guests  have exclusive use  of main bathroom and separate toilet which is nearby their room.
space: Main bathroom and separate lounge are for guests use only.  We prefer to host only 1 group/guest at a time but in busy times they may be shared with other guests. Guest toilet is separate from bathroom. You will have shared use of kitchen and laundry with owners. You will have room to hang clothes and drawers for smaller items. There will be a shelf in our fridge and pantry for food if you require it.
description: This  private room has plenty of space in a quiet household. Walk to local buses and village as well as Town centre. You will share the home with a couple over 60 years and but have your own living area. Guests  have exclusive use  of main bathroom and separate toilet which is nearby their room. Main bathroom and separate lounge are for guests use only.  We prefer to host only 1 group/guest at a time but in busy times they may be shared with other guests. Guest toilet is separate from bathroom. You will have shared use of kitchen and laundry with owners. You will have room to hang clothes and drawers for smaller items. There will be a shelf in our fridge and pantry for food if you require it. Separate lounge, outdoor areas and backyard. Street parking We are happy to interact with our guests as little or as  much they would like. Just let us know how we can help you feel at home We are close to Norwest, Castle Hill and the Hawkesbury region and 50 mins drive to the lower Blue Mountains
neighborhood_overview: We are close to Norwest, Castle Hill and the Hawkesbury region and 50 mins drive to the lower Blue Mountains.  Local bus services run to Blacktown, Parramatta and the city via T way.  We are close to several local sport grounds and  netball courts, the iconic Fiddler and Australian Brewery hotels.
notes: We have a small,  shy dog who doesn't mind meeting new people but does take a little while to get to know you. He is mostly an outside dog.
transit: We are easily accessible by car and by bus from City,  Parramatta/ Westmead or Blacktown. Our closest  rail station is Schofields or Riverstone from which you may require a taxi or bus to nearby our home.
access: Separate lounge, outdoor areas and backyard. Street parking
interaction: We are happy to interact with our guests as little or as  much they would like. Just let us know how we can help you feel at home
house_rules: Please be quiet if returning late at night Please don’t eat your meals in bedrooms As we are a shared home, to ensure adequate hot water for showers for all guests,  please don’t use large amounts of hot water.

host.host_location: Rouse Hill, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about: I am a nurse, mother/grandmother, reader, traveller, lover of the great outdoors, culture and life in general. My partner, Mike loves motorcycling, history and movies. We enjoy meeting new people  from all over the world and learning about their experiences.

reviews.comments: Helen & Mike are the perfect host. Their home is beautiful, their company fantastic and the overall service is the best I have received in Australia outside of a hotel setting. I honestly can not recommend them higher, they really are great people! Thanks so much, Tom.

What an absolute pleasure it has been staying with Helen and her husband (Mike). Helen and Mike had gone above and beyond to ensure I was both comfortable and felt at home. You could not ask for better hosts! My room and bed were comfortable and all other needs were met. Anyone looking to stay in and around the Hills District look no further! 5*****
Helen and Mike are very nice and hospitable and I enjoyed the clean and quite room during my trip. Thank you very much. Hope to be your guest again next time when I am back to Sydney :)

Helen and Mike were great hosts, very friendly, kind and relaxed. I was in the area for some archaeology work, and would often come back to the spotless house covered in dust and mud, but they never complained. The house is in a quiet location but only a short drive to the supermarkets.
Would definitely stay again :)

This was a lovely place to stay with very welcoming people. They were willing to help with info about the locality and anything else necessary.  The accomodation was pleasant and airy even on hot days.  It was beautifully kept. I would not hesitate about booking here again.

name: Adorable Garden Gingerbread House
summary: Romantic hideaway! This property has the lush beauty and privacy of Hana, without the drive! Only 15-20 minutes to the airport, 10 minutes to beaches, 2 minutes to restaurants and shops...on a private gated property with organic nursery. BEAUTIFUL!
space: This place is a gem! SO CUTE!  A recently remodeled 1930's cottage....that Jimi Hendrix stayed in when he was on Maui in 1970 to film Rainbow Bridge. Beautiful, quiet...REAL Maui! Recently remodeled, very cute!  It is lined with cedar on the inside so it smells delightful when you walk in.... The Gingerbread House is a studio cottage with a kitchenette (toaster oven, microwave, coffee maker, counter-top burners, full sized fridge) and spacious bathroom with a large custom-built, tiled shower.. It has high cathedral ceilings with a huge window that looks out on beautiful lush greenery. It is on a gated property.  There is wireless Internet in the cottage, but in the event it isn't working, there is wireless available to you in other locations on the property. We have gotten the internet FIXED since the reviews were written so it is WORKING IN THE GINGERBREAD HOUSE AGAIN! (as of 1/16/17) It has a queen sized bed, and an outdoor patio under the spectacular tree canopy. The property is on
description: Romantic hideaway! This property has the lush beauty and privacy of Hana, without the drive! Only 15-20 minutes to the airport, 10 minutes to beaches, 2 minutes to restaurants and shops...on a private gated property with organic nursery. BEAUTIFUL! This place is a gem! SO CUTE!  A recently remodeled 1930's cottage....that Jimi Hendrix stayed in when he was on Maui in 1970 to film Rainbow Bridge. Beautiful, quiet...REAL Maui! Recently remodeled, very cute!  It is lined with cedar on the inside so it smells delightful when you walk in.... The Gingerbread House is a studio cottage with a kitchenette (toaster oven, microwave, coffee maker, counter-top burners, full sized fridge) and spacious bathroom with a large custom-built, tiled shower.. It has high cathedral ceilings with a huge window that looks out on beautiful lush greenery. It is on a gated property.  There is wireless Internet in the cottage, but in the event it isn't working, there is wireless available to you in other locations
neighborhood_overview: This area is a magical well kept secret on Maui. We are located at the dividing line between the wet side and the dry side, which means we get enough rain to stay green, and enough sun to stay sane! We get rainbows almost daily and are the perfect temperature (60's at night, 70's-80's in the day).
notes: Please note that we have to add the 14.41% Transient accommodations Tax...separately from the airbnb charges. If we included them in the price, you would have to pay airbnb's fees on top of that and it would cost you more....I will send you a "resolution request" through airbnb that will allow you to pay the taxes without any extra fees. We have a HUGE, extremely friendly dog on the property....you will love him!
transit: You definitely need a rental car. The bus stop is 2 miles away...the roads are relatively narrow and windy....
access: You have access to the adorable cottage, wireless internet, shared BBQ and the full 8.5 acres of two adjacent lots that includes The Sacred Garden... We have off road parking on a gated property. You are welcome to help yourself to seasonal fruit.
interaction: We will greet you and orient you to the property and live on the adjacent property so can be there in less than a minute if you need us...but we also respect that you sought our property for privacy. We are available to guide you, answer questions and give you a tour of the farm if desired.
house_rules: This property is a "drama-free zone" so please respect the peace and serenity concept.... Our biggest rule is that you respect the land, people, plants and animals on it...and yourselves as well! Please note check in is after 3:00pm and Check out is 11:00am. Changes to this need to be planned well in advance to coordinate with cleaners. Thank you. Otherwise, the cleaning crew will be showing up promptly at the check out time of 11. We welcome children but ask that parents monitor them while in the yard....this is "real nature" with a seasonal stream, slippery rocks, etc. and we do not want anyone hurt. Please take 100% responsibility for your safety and that of your children. Quiet hours are 9pm-8am. Noise projected beyond the property during quiet hours is not allowed. This is a working nursery and farm so please know that we do work and live here. It is very private however, others are on the property. It is a LARGE property.... We appreciate respectful, responsible people who are ca

host.host_about:
We are friendly, fun, hardworking people happy to share our beautiful piece of paradise with you. We are writers, photographers, gardeners/farmers, divers, entrepreneurs, animal lovers, artistic, creative people dedicated to living peaceful, drama-free lives. We have been together for over 20 years, and on Maui longer than that. 
This property is the cure for "Nature-Deficit-Disorder"....let us give you a tour of the farm and garden, teach you about coffee production and tropical plants....then make a smoothie (or other delicious tropical beverage!) from fresh banana, mango or likikoi!

reviews.comments:
We had a great time at your brand newly upgraded cozy, little gingerbread home! Eve and Steve (Jeff Bridges twin brother LOL!!!) are amazing hosts. This is a beautiful location, very lush, wooded garden with a nice river in the back of the cabin. Eve has an awesome sacred garden located on the property. It is very unique, peaceful, serene, excellent for relaxing and meditation. The gingerbread is close to a cool little beach town called Paia and the Baldwin Beach Park. Thank you for letting us enjoy your beautiful property. We definitely recommend the Gingerbread House for couples!
P.S. Don't bring an alarm clock, the roosters will be happy to wake you up in the morning!

This was a great place to stay and a great experience.  There are interesting grounds and the amazing plant nursery to explore, and there is also Eve's Forbidden Fruit Stand.  The Gingerbread House is truely unique.  It is very interesting and has been recently remodeled.  A beautiful place inside and out.  The grounds offer a variety of fruit trees and it is set in tropical rain forest.  It was a most pleasurable base for our adventures on Maui.

Eve's enchanted jungle cottage was amazing! It was just what we needed! The seasonal creek behind the house was flowing, the tangerines were juicy and ripe, and the succulent garden was spectacular! Eve has really created a special place with her creativity and green thumb! The labyrinths arranged on the property were fantastic for clearing the mind so we even bought a book Eve wrote about labyrinths. Thanks for the beautiful accommodations! Bodhi the dog is super chilled out and cool to have around too. Very private but not overly isolated. Perfect place!
We love this place and this house. It's a small paradise. Eve is a great host and woman.

Eve's place is sweet, cozy and a complemented our Maui experience. Nestled next to a stream with trees laden with oranges, lemons and bananas, the Gingerbread House delivered all the comforts and ease of home, while providing great views of the tropical trees towering above us. Morning chickens would cluck near our door and the friendliest dog in the world, Bodhi, always gave us a nuzzle. The house is on property shared with Eve's plant nursery -a beautiful setting that completes the picture.

We loved this cozy little cottage!  It was close to the airport, and only a few miles away from Paia, a happening little town.  The Sacred Garden was pretty amazing. The grounds were quiet, and we loved the rain at night falling on our rooftop.  It was a very peaceful and relaxing place.  Thanks Eve for letting us stay.  Hoping to come back and visit again one day. Mahalo!

Eve and Steve were really outgoing and helpful -- and the cottage was fantastic. The place is situated in a beautiful landscape with lots to explore. Inside it's cozy, clean and the sort of place you want to tuck away inside for a few days to relax. There's a great little kitchen and big bathroom so there's no "roughing it" about this place. Highly recommend this spot as Eve and Steve have clearly thought through all of the details to make it a great place to stay in Maui.
This beautiful, clean, comfy cabin is located in a gorgeous haven called the Sacred Garden.  It was everything we hoped it would be!!

Eve's Gingerbread House really is adorable and the grounds around it is so beautiful. There's even a stream running close by which you can hear from inside the house. The place looks even better than the photos. Wifi and cellular reception can be spotty, but what a great location to explore this part of Maui! Makawao and Paia is a five to fifteen minute drive away with restaurants and hiking trails close by. I highly recommend staying here. The place is charming, comfy, and cozy!

As there are so many comments in English we decide to serve the German speaking customers with a comment in German:
Die Lage von Eve's Gingerbread-House für die Erkundung der gesamten Insel ist optimal. Das GB-House befindet sich auf einem tropischen Grundstück mit einem Bach, dessen Plätschern einen angenehm in den Schlaf sinken lässt. Bett, Kitchenette mit Kühlschrank und Sofa bilden den Wohnraum. Das separate Bad hat eine tolle Dusche. Das gesamte Cottage ist sehr gepflegt und sehr sauber.  Das Bett ist typisch "amerikanisch bequem".  Der Internetzugang im Haus klappte während unseres Aufenthaltes nicht, war aber bei Eve möglich.  Eve ist eine herzliche und hilfsbereite Gastgeberin. Wir haben uns hier sehr wohl gefühlt und können das GB-House empfehlen.

This was a wonderful experience! It was also our first time using Airbnb and visiting a Hawaiian Island and we would definitely do it all over again. Early in our planning we intentionally made the decision to avoid the big resorts and seek out something that felt a little more like the "real" Hawaii. Eve's rustic cabin provided just that. The cabin was clean and comfy, with a great amount of lighting and windows. One of my favorite parts of the cabin was the large window high above the kitchen that looks into the jungle across the stream. It almost looks like a framed painting every morning when you wakeup.  The chirping birds in the jungle made it that much better. The property is close to Makawao and Pa'ia, both of which have great dinning and shopping and a great small town feel. We still visited the big resort towns for the beaches which weren't too far away. A baby beach protected by a reef is also just 10 min away! We found the cabin to be a great central location to see just about everything on the island. 

Tip: We bought the book "Maui Revealed" before we made this trip and used it religiously the entire time we were there. Kula Bistro is a must, Makawao fresh morning doughnuts in the white building with green trim and usually a line (it's quick I promise!) 808 Cafe has great food and is across the street from our favorite beaches. Drive to Hana takes all day if you go all the way around, but is so very worth it. Get out and see everything! Bring food!
The Gingerbread Cottage is a perfect central location to everything on the island, but far enough from the hustle of the towns. Be sure to do the labyrinth walks on the property, it's a great way to prepare your mind to enjoy your vacation, also go sit by the river and read a bit, it's very relaxing. We will be back next year!!!

Steve met me when I arrived. He was friendly and suggested places to eat during my stay. The gingerbread house was clean and comfortable. It had everything you might need. A kitchen area with fridge and microwave. A nice bathroom with a large shower. I enjoyed my time there.

The Gingerbread House was a great place for a stay at Maui. Perfect gateaway for our Honeymoon! Very privat and direct in jungle. 
Staying at the Gingerbread House was a great experience! 
Mahalo

Loved the Garden Gingerbread house.  It was peaceful, great location and had everything I needed.

Thanks Eve.

Me and my girlfriend had a wonderful time staying at the  Gingerbread house!  We wanted to be excluded from  other tourists  and the big hotels and this was exactly what we were looking for.  The stream flowing in the back of the house is great,!  The inside and outside is beautiful!  It's at a high elevation so driving  to or from other cities is awesome seeing  the views!  I would definitely recommend staying here!!!

Staying at the Garden Gingerbread House was the best decision of our trip. This beautiful oasis in the center of the gulch is where to find tranquility and peace. Eve was a phenomenal host who met us upon arrival to explain the ins and outs of this spectacular property. The smell of  cedar permeated throughout and it had every amenity we could ever need. As we walked the grounds, we were able to benefit from the sounds of water running through the creek, birds chirping, Bodhi on his latest adventure and explore The Sacred Garden next door. The labyrinth is a must! Mahalo to Eve for all of her recommendations. We found healing in a very special place and will never forget this glorious experience. Hope to be back again!

We had a wonderful stay at the gingerbread house. Eve and Steve were wonderful and attentive hosts. They had great tips on what to do and where to go, and we spent the week eating lilikois from their garden. The cottage is just enough for two, comfortable with a killing shower. The cooler was a very nice touch and we carried it everyday with us. It is the ideal location if you want to explore Upcountry Maui and still be very private. That is if you can do with the upside of a forest getaway: bugs. Unfortunately for us I had a bad reaction to mosquito bites, but that's on us.
Eve was very hospitable and the property was so much more amazing than advertised! Felt so tranquil and magical there, exactly what we needed to get away. Thank you Eve!

Eve is very helpful and sweet.
The house is wonderful, a dream. Unfortunately I was afraid for spider and insects. The house is very clean and complete with everything but it's in wood and in the middle of a fantastic Garden.
Eve understand immediately and give us other accomodation, as beautiful as that.
We lived four relaxing days in her home so wonderful that was very difficult leave that place..
Thank you Eve, we lived a dream.
The house was absolutely adorable & homey & very tastefully decorated. It was exactly as the listing described it as.

Our stay in Maui and in the Gingerbread House was nothing short of magical.  The location was secluded and romantic, but still within a short drive to many towns and more busy areas.  We felt at home right away.  The kitchen was stocked with all of the appliances we needed to cook meals, and shortly upon arrival Eve (our most gracious host) handed us a packet of recommendations and directions, as well as telling us where the nearest local market was.  We explored the whole island, and never felt like anything was too far since it was such a central point.  We definitely had to apply the bug repellant liberally, even when going to bed, but that is what happens when you stay in the forest!  Even though the property has other houses and a workplace on it- we never felt crowded or infringed upon.  Also- right now the property has liliko'i (passion fruit) blooming like crazy and we were able to gather and feast on it daily! The gardens attached to the property are also very beautiful and worth a look.  We were very sad to hear they were having a full moon walk on the eve of our departure!  All in all I would HIGHLY recommend staying at any one of the properties that Eve and Steve run, but we will definitely be returning to the Gingerbread house the next time we make it to Maui!!

Eve was super helpful and suggested several locations to check out. The fruit on the grounds were delicious. Very quite and private place to relax. The stream was dry when we went so if it was running I'm sure it would have added another element of tranquility. Don't forget to check out the gardens on the property and walk the labyrinth.

My husband and I stayed in the Gingerbread house for 3 nights. It was a great experience, very quaint and quiet. We loved staying in Makawao we were within minutes of everything. We often visited Paia during this time. The nursery is beautifully kept and we felt like we were in our own private jungle. Loved the big bathroom and large shower. We definitely plan to recommend this location to others.

We spent 6 nights of our honeymoon at the Gingerbread House, everything is exactly as advertised, a real hideaway in the middle of the jungle, but not too far away from all the interesting places. The passion fruits are falling off the trees. We will defenitely miss that. Don't be scared of animal running over the roof at night

The gingerbread house at the sacred garden was a great find. Extremely clean, beautiful grounds and an extremely accommodating host. Eve made sure we got everything we needed and was always accessible if need be.

The host was there to please and every detail for living in this little cottage was provided for you.  The cottage's architecture is wonderful and the house is surrounded by trees since in a jungle atmosphere.  The cottage was overly  too busy/crowded , however, with large beds and scatter rugs, pictures, mounds of pillows etc. for me.  (I am much more zen but this is a matter of personal taste).  It is very quiet with eating space outdoors which was lovely especially for morning breakfast. There is a musty smell so keep the windows open.  The location is terrific within easy reach of a beach, towns, eating places, etc.

The Ginger Bread House was a fantastic place! Loved that it was our own little get away after exploring Maui. The historic downtown (3min away) was great for dinner and the general store has everything you need. Although I briefly met Eve as she was traveling when we were there, she was a great host and teed everything up for our stay. Amazing spot and we will be back!!!! 

Also- the shower is five star quality :)

Highly recommend this delightful hide-away! Gingerbread House is just as described and would stay again. Refreshing to escape the routine tourist on-goings in Maui.  Wonderful being able to relax and to enjoy the property with access to gardens and labyrinths. Eve is a very nice host with the perfect blend of availability and privacy. Also, easy to spend time exploring Makawao and Paia from here.

Eve was extremely welcoming and close by if we needed anything, but  cottage was secluded enough that we had lots of privacy. We were surrounded by amazing fruit trees and helped ourselves to freshly picked tangerines, guavas, passion fruit and logan berries - so delicious! The pictures very accurate...the cottage was pristinely clean and comfortable and had everything we needed to feel at home. The locations was ideal, a few minutes to a cute town and close to the national park. The ONE thing that was lacking was the WiFi connection. I failed to read that there was none in the cabin. There was however access at a nearby gazebo, although the connection was not great. I would definitely recommend the Ginger Bread House. Thanks for a great stay Eve!

The Gingerbread House is an amazing little cottage in Eve and Steve's island sanctuary. It has everything you need for a relaxing jungle getaway. You can tell there is a lot of thought put into everything on the property especially the newly renovated cabin. It sits on a sprawling jungle compound that has many nooks to explore. The house itself is fully equipped. It has a wonderful bathroom and shower. The overall space feels much bigger than it looks in the pictures. We met Eve for a brief time, but we could tell she was a beam of light. Her smile was bright and her laugh contagious. The property is centrally located and a quick drive from downtown Paia, Haiku, and Makawao. We have been very lucky with our AirBnb stays and this was another to add to the list.

We had an incredible time at the Gingerbread House, on the Sacred Garden retreat property.  The little house itself is so comfortable, with everything you need, and the bed was really comfortable!  Eve was very welcoming and wonderful, and had tons of great tips for us.   The gardens are lush and beautiful, and we loved picking fruit off the trees.  We would come back in a heartbeat.

We enjoyed our stay in the ginger bread house very much. All was clean and well equipped. As we travelled with our two sons it was a bit too small. But the place is recommended for two so that was our own "risk". The garden is gorgeous and very peaceful.
We didn't have the chance to talk to Eve that much but she was very nice and communication via airbnb was fine.
A wonderful house and a great location!

the gingerbread house was  a big highlight of our vacation in maui. the property is so beautiful and peaceful, the stars at night were incredible... definitely an unforgettable place! 

eve was great & very easy to communicate -  highly recommended!

The Gingerbread House was the best place our wife and I have ever stayed, anywhere. 

Eve greeted us in the driveway to take us in the house and show us around. Moments later Steve popped in to introduce himself as well. The place was INCREDIBLE. A beautiful, upscale little cottage that looks like it was just built. It had a faint, refreshing smell of fresh cedar from the walls and was spotlessly clean. It was cozy and felt like we were staying in our own little home. Everything we needed was provided from extra towels, to bath products (in an awesome bathroom), to coffee and cookies to start our stay off deliciously.

The grounds of the property were epic and because of a recent rain the stream was in full force. We watched it flow over coffee every morning and picked a few tangerines from their tree for breakfast. In the afternoon we sat stream side and read for hours in what might be the most peaceful setting we've ever encountered. We also wandered their adjacent property, The Sacred Garden to take in the labyrinth and nursery as well as the organic farm.

It's a huge property that feels like you're secluded from the world yet it's only a few minutes drive to the quaint historic Makawao town with plenty of restaurants, or Paia, the coolest beach town on Maui with shops and some of the best dining on the island. It's also the beginning of the famed Road to Hana which is a must-drive while you're there.

We only saw Eve a few times during our 5 day stay but she checked in regularly via text to make sure we were happy. She stopped by just before we left to say goodbye and give us hugs. 

As much as we loved the other places we stayed this is easily the best of the bunch. We plan to return again next year and hopefully make it an annual holiday trip to Maui. Highly recommend a stay here!

Our stay at the Gingerbread House was amazing.  eve met us at the property and was very thorough on explaining everything.  The cottage and bed were so cozy and comfortable and we had everything we needed.  Well almost...we had failed to bring any warm clothing (bc it was Hawaii!!) and we were due to have a mtn bike ride at 9,000 ft (brrrrr) and Eve showed up with all sorts of sweatshirts and jackets for BOTH my boyfriend and I and that made such a huge difference on the ride!!  We also got to take place in a full moon labrynth ceremony which was on the grounds and that was special to both of us.  Perfect spot, perfect little cottage and perfect hosts...what more could you ask for ??

What a perfect little getaway. Husband and I have been to Hawaii many times and wanted something different, away from the wall of condo buildings by the beaches. 

Makawao is a charming Upcountry town and the cottage at the Sacred Garden, a short drive away from town, was comfortable and quiet. It is very well appointed with cooking implements that allowed us to make breakfast every morning and dinner many nights. Large bathroom and good storage for our gear. The cottage is perfect for two people and perhaps a young child but any more would feel crowded. 

The Hogans recently added wifi capabilities so you can check your email and post updates to make your (Hidden by Airbnb) friends envious of your visit. There is no television but a monitor with a DVD player for movies. Beautifully dark at night, we had spectacular star gazing every evening. We had not realized that there was a washing machine and dryer available to us -- a great surprise. 

Eve welcomed us when we arrived in the evening and gave an overview of the grounds, what fruits were in season and ready to pick (tangarines and avos!) and offered any support we may need. Otherwise, we never saw her or Steve. There is a working nursery on the property and so a little bit of car traffic right by the cottage around 9 AM and 5 PM. By little bit, I am talking about three cars. 

On Maui, you need to drive everywhere. The closest beach is in Paia, about 20 minutes away. Being in Upcountry, you are on your way up to Haleakala, a short drive from Kahului where you can get whatever provisions you need and we learned shortcuts to Kihei and the East Maui beaches. 

The cottage (and the spirit of Jimi) was a memorable stay on Maui. If you are looking for the road less travelled plus want approving nods from the locals when asked about where you are staying, check out the gingerbread cottage.

My husband and I had an AMAZING time, our only regret is that we didn't stay longer! Eve is a gracious host and she helped us with everything we needed.The property is beautiful and we really enjoyed the fresh fruit trees right out of the back door. The cottage is comfortable, cozy and very peacful.

Had a very relaxing stay in an awesome environment! Internet was down but we still had our phones and they worked pretty good up there. And actually disconnecting from the web was therapeutic! Here I am still on vacation writing this note from my timeshare, already back on the grid!   
Mahalo!
Dan
Steve and Eve were both friendly and helpful. They even helped us out when our trip was extended due to a late flight. The home and grounds were beautiful. Thanks!

Eve greeted us at the driveway and gave us a tour of the Gingerbread House. It is the perfect space and offers an amazing getaway. The property is awesome. We were able to sit out back and enjoy the scenery and running stream as well as roam around and explore. The Gingerbread House had everything we needed: towels, shampoo, dishes, a washer and dryer, etc. There were even a library of books and DVDs and a deck of cards. Be sure to check all the drawers and cabinets because we kept finding more and more goodies all over. The one thing worth mentioning is the hot water. It lasts just long enough to take the fastest shower of your life, then it runs out all at once. It wasn't a nuisance or anything, just be prepared to be very, very fast in the shower! There are a few other rentals on the property that all sit pretty close to each other, but we never saw or heard other people. It is like having that beautiful jungle to yourself. Overall, our experience at the Gingerbread House was perfect. If (when) we return to Maui, this is the only way to go! Thanks, Eve and Steve!

We were warmly welcomed into a beautiful peaceful garden home. It was peaceful and cool for sleeping and we loved being able to make our own dinners.  The location was great as we were able to travel all over the island without any difficultly.

We loved our stay.
Bill & Laurinda Boyes

Eve was away so unfortunately we didn't meet her, however Steve her husband welcomed us and told us all about the house and the gardens. It was all that we expected a charming cosy house well equipped and very comfortable. As the house is totally made from Cedar wood the smell inside was fantastic always fresh and calming.
The house is close to Paia and the lovely beaches - 10-15  minute drive, all of which are on the Hana highway so easy access to the airport at Kahului and 'The road to Hana I would definitely recommend staying here if you want quiet country style accommodation with easy access to everything else.

We had a wonderful stay in the Gingerbread Cottage. The location was perfect, in the jungle away from the tourist areas but close enough to everything we wanted to do and see.
Eve left a book full of detailed directions to the places we wanted to  visit.

The cottage was clean and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. There were lots of clean fluffy towels in the bathroom. 
The birds gave a lovely concert every morning.
I would recommend this cottage to anyone who wants a unique holiday experience away from the crowds.

our stay on the sacred garden property was full of magic.  we felt at home quickly, and easily flowed.  the beautiful creekside lawn was a favorite spot to relax, lay in the sun, listen to the water run.  the house was well-appointed and comfortable.  thank you for a lovely stay!

What a beautiful place on Upcountry-Maui! The Gingerbread house is located in a wonderful, big garden and Eve made us really feel like being in paradise during our stay. We even had breakfast with self-picked bananas and tangerines out of the garden!
The Gingerbread house is equipped with everything you need, has a really comfortable bed and a cute bathroom.
If we ever return to Maui: this is the place we would choose again and again!
Mahalo Eve! Dankeschön!

Acceuil chaleureux de eve. Charmante petite maison dans la jungle: tres ronantique !.
Eve nous a apportes des fruits frais du jardin: avocat, fruits de la passion, tangerines....

Place was as decribed.
Eve´s hospitalty was excellent. Pretty much oriented to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Interested in all possible hickup´s.
The house was equiped with some amenities you would rather expect in a hotel.
If you are into nature and looking for a central place on Maui, this is a recomandation.

From the first moment, we felt very comfortable in the gingerbread house. We had an amazing time there and Eve was very nice and friendly to us. Everything in the house was very clean. Especially we enjoyed the lovely garden and the surrounding in general.

Eve was a wonderful host. Kind and welcoming. She brought us fresh avocados from her tree and made sure we had everything we needed in addition to giving us lots of hints about good places to eat and stuff to see.

The cottage was adorable and cozy. Just be aware, the jungle can be loud -- the local bird and animal life made it a little tough to sleep the first night as we were adjusting.

The neighborhood is great. Paia is a fabulous little town with plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. The Gingerbread Cottage is close to the Hana Highway, Haleakala and all the fabulous upcountry stuff to do and it's not too far a drive to hit the resort area on the west side.

We are feeling very relaxed after 4 nights in the Gingerbread house. The setting is amazing, and we were able to explore the grounds and enjoy the jungle and river-side seats. Eve was a very gracious host which contributed greatly to feeling relaxed as soon as we arrived.
Highly recommend the gingerbread house and as big music fans, we were intrigued by it's history.

Everything was seamless and easy from check in to check out.  Eve was an excellent host making sure to give tips and recommendations to ensure our stay was both fun and relaxing.  Highly recommended.  Thanks!

Die Unterkunft war traumhaft, Ferienfeeling vom Feinsten. Wunderschön in Maui gelegen haben wir uns dort sehr wohl gefühlt. Dazu beigetragen haben auch die grossartigen Gastgeber Eve und Steve, welche uns herzlich empfangen und alles genau erklärt haben. Den Schnorchelausflug zum Molokinikrater haben wir auch bei ihnen gebucht, was ein unvergessliches Erlebnis für uns war. Wir können die Unterkunft und Gastgeber allen weiterempfehlen.

Accueil chaleureux et amical, Eve se rend très disponible pour toutes questions. Logement correspondant en tous points au descriptif, donc vraiment très mignon, le terme adorable convient effectivement !
La végétation environnante est vraiment somptueuse et la situation en légère altitude fournit une fraicheur bienvenue.
A recommander définitivement !
Sans oublier la possibilité de massage inoubliable de la part de Maureen.

When we first arrived in Maui- I had called Eve to let her know that we were finally there.. She was actually out of the state, but was 100% helpful and very sweet- she answered my calls and my texts right away! We were greeted by Steve and Bodie when we first arrived in Makawao! Super friendly and extremely helpful with everything, gave us insight on nearby places to eat and things to do. The cottage and the property are beyond beautiful! We made friends with Bodie and all the chickens :) The cottage is in an amazing location and we got to experience a lot while we were there. It was a short drive to the Town of Makawao and Pa'ia (2 of the 3 towns that we absolutely LOVED! Hana is the 3rd :D) We went ziplining, hiking, saw the Sunrise and biked down Haleakala, went to the beach and just enjoyed Upcountry! After all of those adventures it was nice to kick back and relax at the cottage :) I already miss it..

Tolles kleines Knusperhäuschen mitten im Regenwald. Die Lage war für uns ideal, da man die Insel ideal erkunden kann. Sehr gut eingerichtet und gemütlich. Wir waren mit unserem fünfjährigen Sohn dort und er hat es geliebt (vor allem die Hühner rund ums Haus). Eve und Steve sind tolle Gastgeber und wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt.

Eve had many helpful necessities in the gingerbread house like bug spray ,towels, toiletries , kitchen supplies etc. the neighborhood was beautiful and quiet. Eve was very welcoming told us helpful things and things we should know about the gingerbread house, the land, and the island.The itinerary she left us was very useful on how to get around to many things on the island like the closest town, good places to eat and much more.

We had a lovely, restful time at the Gingerbread Cottage. Eve was very communicative and helpful. She also left clear instructions and information about swimming beaches, hikes and directions. We even went snorkeling with her husband one day out at Molokini. Great experience! We would definitely return!!

Perfect stay- romantic, beautiful, peaceful. The cabin is stocked with all the necessities+ and we felt that Eve was available for questions, but also that we were left to enjoy a private honeymoon. we are definitely coming back. Mahalo, Eve!

We were looking forward to our stay at the Gingerbread House and it exceeded our expectations. Couldn't have asked for more. Lovely setting, exquisite craftsmanship, and attention to detail. Eve was very responsive and delightful. Her enthusiasm and reverence for this magical property were evident. The description and photos on Airbnb  accurately represented what we experienced in person. There was so much to discover in the Sacred Garden. What a gem. We're working on a way to be able to return to this very special corner of Maui with wonderful hosts, Eve and Steve.
A very nice and cozy little cottage! Eve was a great host and gave us very useful hints for Maui. Bohdi and the chicken gang were also very kind to us ;-)

Eve and the Gingerbread cottage were great! What a unique experience.  Cozy cottage, all the essentials included. Including towels toiletries bug spray coffee and even cookies! This is the jungle, so there are bugs and the roosters due announce themselves pretty early!  There is a stream nearby the cottage, the river flowed in and Eve came and got us to experience it! Very cool

No AC, but you don't need it.  Convenient location to Paia and Haiku and trips to the top of Haleakala for sunset. Great hikes near by! Bring your boots!

I recommend the cottage for anyone who wants a different type of Maui experience. We would return!

Thanks Eve and Steve for a great stay!

We really enjoyed our stay at the cottage. It is very central for getting around. It is located just inside the jungle so it is wetter than the coast but that's not really a problem.

The place is very charming with great bathroom and eating facilities. Eve was away on our trip but Steve was also very helpful.

We had a very warm welcome by Eve's assistant Tanda who showed us the Gingerbread house and the surroundings. The house is located on a very large porperty with a variety of green plants around far away from any 500 bedroom hotel - just nature around! This leads also to a pleasant climate (no AC necessary:)
The north shore of Maui is very close if you want to go surfing (Paia is only 10 minutes away) and Kahului with the airport is only 20 minutes away.
A special thanks goes to Eve and Tanda for fulfilling an individual request in advance:)
We had a great time and would definitely come back:)

Eve greeted us upon arrival and was so wonderful! She showed us around the cottage and property and made us feel completely at home. 

The property was isolated and quiet, but was not far away from the beach or towns like Paia. It was exactly as described--with one exception of there being no wi-fi or 4g access in the cottage.

We enjoyed our time here a lot and look forward to coming back!

Leading up to our stay Eve communicated well via email to make sure we had everything we needed. The house is beautiful and tucked away in a secluded part of Maui and it was nice having a whole house to ourselves at the end of a busy day. Its set in a tropical garden so we felt part of our surroundings, especially at night when we'd leave the windows open so we could wake up to all the natural sounds outside. The house came fully equipped with kitchen facilities so we could cook our own meals plus a good sized bathroom area. The host also left instructions which were helpful. A couple of minor things we would've liked - one was wifi in the room. Even though this was a minor issue, there were times when it was raining and we'd have to walk out to the gazebo to use the internet. Also, during out 4 day stay, because Eve and her partner were on holiday we didn't meet with anyone the whole time we were there. Even though we arrived late at night, we thought someone would've dropped by to introduce themselves some time during our stay. This wasn't a huge deal though as our overall stay was fantastic. Loved the house and the location and would absolutely stay there again.

What a great, charming little cabin in the jungle! Very cozy and clean, perfect for my wife, son and I. It is a 5 minute drive to Makawao which is a fun little town with restaurants and cafes and a 10 minute drive to funky Paia and it's awesome beaches. This was also a good location for driving to the summit of Haleakala to catch sunrise. Highly recommended!

My wife and I stayed at the Gingerbread house for our honeymoon and it was amazing.  I would love to live in a small home like this; very cozy, simple, and yes, it is adorable.  The Gingerbread house is located in a private property, called the Sacred Garden. The sacred garden is a very fitting name for this piece of land as it is very peaceful and spiritual.   It is surrounded by nature, it has a river flowing in the background, and is a spiritual retreat center as well.

Our host Eve was out of town during our stay but she did a wonderful job ensuring that everything was ready for us and provided all the information we needed during our stay.  

Thank you so much and definitely recommended!
Schöne Unterkunft mitten in der Natur; gute Lage zur Erkundung der Insel; freundliche Leute auf dem Gelände

We were so lucky to stumble upon Eve's wonderful place.  For us the setting was ideal.  It was quiet, beautiful and hard to leave.  The house was well equipped and we had everything we needed for our peaceful stay.  We were greeted by Eve and Bohdi and they also saw us off, which was really nice. It was close to Hana road which was a definite plus. It was nice to be close to towns but far enough away to relax and enjoy nature. Everyone we encountered at Sacred Gardens were beyond friendly and nice to talk to.  It is a wonderful place and was certainly hard to leave.
What a unique place to stay!  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Gingerbread House.  One of our favorite activities from the trip was exploring the grounds and all the exotic fruit trees!

Eve was very responsive before and during our trip.  She gave us easy to follow directions to her place from the airport and then was out front to greet us when we arrived. She showed us around, gave us some pointers and then let us get situated.  The cottage was exactly what we expected. It was so charming and due to the relatively remote location we felt perfectly disconnected and "away" from everything.  We had one small issue finding blankets which Eve immediately took care of once I notified her.  
This property is dreamy.  It is a beautiful, serene retreat... away from 'tourist' Hawaii, but close enough to conveniences.  We fell in love with the labyrinth next door and now my son wants to seek out every labyrinth we can find.  Thank you for the use of this wonderful little slice of heaven.

Eve came to our door right after we got there to welcome us and tell us where everything was. She was always available by text when I had questions and would answer back right away. The cabin and area were beautiful, and it was a great area to stay in Maui. We loved it and would come back again!

Beautiful place to stay on Maui! The grounds were amazing and the location was incredibly convenient--centrally located not too far from anything and very nice to not be stuck in one location, as we would have been if we had stayed at a resort. The Gingerbread House had everything we needed for a nice relaxing vacation.

The Gingerbread House did not disappoint. Clean, simple and cozy. Located in a peaceful and quiet area, it was a joy to stay there away – from the hustle and bustle of the major resort areas. It was great to listen to rain at night on the roof of the cottage and to wake to the sounds of the local wildlife in the morning. Staying here added to the experience of visiting Maui. Recommended.

BETTER THAN PICTURES OR DESCRIPTION. My wife and I were absolutely captivated by this cool, earthy tiny home, that smelled of sweet cedar and brought the word "getaway" to a new meaning. Best of all, Eve was a superb host-- super down to earth and made us feel so at home... We especially enjoyed picking oranges from her tree and exploring the forest :) 

Also the house was fully loaded with everything you could possibly need :) 

Thanks Eve!

The gingerbread house was really cool. Walking around the property was awesome, lots of fresh fruit trees, animals and gorgeous scenery.
Eve was super personable and had so much great info to share. The property was quiet and tranquil. We loved our stay at the gingerbread house.
The gingerbread house was incredibly adorable. Very clean and cozy! And the property is amazing. I would definitely come back and stay here on my next visit to Maui.
Incredible grounds and incredible guest cottage! This place is a destination itself! I would go back in heartbeat.
GORGEOUS and IMMACULATE!  We loved this little gem.  Great location and friendly hosts.  This cozy retreat had everything we could need.  Exquisite remodel.  Highly recommend.

This is really a great place, hidden in the jungle. Description is very accurate, everything you can dream of is there in the house for you to use (even beach towels and boogieboards !!), all in perfect condition.
Eve and Steve are so great people !
Unfortunately, we did not see them much because of a busy schedule on our side.
Some things to note: in the gardens more than one rooster with their hens roam, and these have a tendency to call out even in the middle of the night with the moonlight .. if you need complete quietness, this might not be your place. Also note it's (civilized) jungle, so you might see some critters ! We saw a huge frog in front of the patio door, a large centipede (inside the house at the door, we brought it back out where it belongs), some Mongoose jump around the cottage and surf on the roof in the night. 
Great smell of cedar wood in the house, by the way !

We really liked all this, but some city-zens might not be ready for it.

Again, it's a GREAT place, great people, i can highly recommend to stay with Eve and Steve if you look for a place in Makawao.
What an absolutely wonderful place! Eve is so gracious and welcoming. The Gingerbread House is a rare gem and so charming!

Eve's cottage was even better than the photos! Well appointed with everything one could need for a stay in the upcountry. Eve was incredibly helpful and welcoming, and the amenities were a nice added touch. We enjoyed picking tangerines and lemon from the trees near the cottage. It was unfortunate that we could only fit in a one night stay...but we will definitely be back!
It's a great place to stay. Very comfortable and relaxing.
Great experience - spacious, clean, well-stocked, beautifully decorated! Also good central location

I'm not even certain how I can describe how incredible Eve and the Gingerbread house were! First the house/property are in a perfect location on the island if you are there to explore and be away from all of the tourists! It is so very peaceful, yet a close drive to stores, restaurants, beaches, mountains, and the airport. The Gingerbread is such a beautiful little gem...the smell of cedar and the sound of birds greeted us everyday and simply helped us ease into the right mind set for a wonderful vacation! The property is lovely. Complete with fruit trees, flowers an incredible labyrinth. The only problem we had with it was getting enough motivation to leave that wonderful place in the mornings to go explore the island!

Eve was wonderful as well! She made us feel so welcomed and was very helpful with all of our inquiries. All in all an incredible place run by wonderful people!

Eve took the time to welcome us and introduce us to the property, where we had a lovely three-day stay. The grounds are wonderful, the building has been very recently remodeled, and many extras were provided, including very good coffee and tea. Thanks!

Eve and her husband were both lovely.   We were met when we first arrived.  The cottage contained a very helpful instruction and suggestion guide.   We had been looking for "baby beach" with no suggest and the directions in her book were perfect.   
The Gingerbread Cottage was charming with appreciated artistic touches.   The setting was beautiful, as described.  The rental houses were a bit closer together than expected but when one guest was challenged with noisy children Even was immediately "on it" to maintain a serene and restful atmosphere.   Eve was kind enough to personally loan us beach chairs and to suggest a website where I could purchase a specific small statue I was looking for.  We especially enjoyed meeting Bodie, the dog... for a little pet therapy!
Beautiful tranquil spot and handy to nearby townships and road to hana. Traditional finishes and well maintained and equipped. Loved the puppy and warm welcome thank you.

Le logement est conforme à sa description, une adorable petite maison au milieu d'un jardin tropical. L'endroit est très calme, idéal pour se ressourcer, profiter de la plage et faire des randonnées en forêt. La maison est très bien équipée. Nous n'avons pas eu l'occasion de voir Eve et Steve qui avaient des obligations. Ils nous ont envoyé une amie pour nous accueillir.

My fiancée and I had an amazing time staying at The Gingerbread House. The cottage was immaculately clean, well stocked, and had a calming cedar smell that put is at ease after a long, tiring flight. Eve left us a binder of places to eat, local beaches, and hikes with driving directions which was helpful when planning our day.  Eve was very responsive to our text messages prior to our arrival and also during our stay; she also arranged a snorkeling to Molokini Crater which was fantastic!  The grounds in the Sacred Garden are beautiful! We explored the property and sampled some of the fruit, yum!  If you're looking for a secluded, remote location, away from the hustle and bustle of high traffic tourist areas, I highly recommend staying at the Gingerbread House.

What a beautiful cottage to have as home base to explore all the amazing treasures around you.  My first night it rained and was so peaceful to listen to the stream and feel the cool night air.  Driving through the valley, rainbows galore!  What a truly special place with lovely energy!  Will definitely go back!

My husband and I started our stay in Maui at this beautiful cottage, and it was the perfect beginning to a wonderful vacation!  From the moment we were greeted by Eve (and a chicken!) in the yard, we knew we had chosen the right place.  The cottage and surrounding land were even better than one can imagine from the photos.  We loved sitting by the stream behind the cottage, which is absolutely beautiful.  Eve was extremely helpful to us in planning our visit and hiking on Haleakala, choosing a restaurant, etc. She also had coffee and cookies waiting for us - definitely a plus.  This is a great location for starting your vacation on Maui, as it is close to the airport, yet close to Haleakala National Park, several small towns, and beaches - you can settle into the peacefulness of Maui before heading down the road to Hana.  We would definitely love to stay here again and highly recommend it to those who want something other than the resort experience.

This place was an absolute dream for my husband and I, so much so, that we got married on the property. It is the perfect private retreat in the middle of Maui. Quiet, beautiful, and really feels like your own home. When we left, we were disappointed at the thought of someone staying in "our house"! Eve is one of the kindest ladies you could have the pleasure of meeting, and she went above any beyond to accommodate any of our needs. Beach towels in the house are a huge plus as you are in Maui, and any little thing you have don't have to pack is an advantage. Full sized working fridge and appliances, fresh bag of coffee, and fresh cookies were all there on our arrival. The dog on the property is a sweetie , and is a nice touch of pet therapy in a home away from home. The Sacred Garden on the property is breathtaking, and my husband and i loved the local advice given to us by Eve and some of her employees. Upon leaving we had forgotten a pretty expensive bluetooth speaker, and she was kind enough to text us and keep it in her home so we could retrieve it before catching our plane. The backyard is much more beautiful than the pictures, as they have added a patio and outdoor fireplace. We can't rave about this place enough, and are planning on coming back next summer with our children! You won't regret staying with on this property, and hope others will fall in love with it the same way we did!

What a magical place! Stayed here for one night last week and wish we could have stayed the whole time. Eve was lovely and gave us great tips. The grounds were beautiful and I loved the shower! Would definitely stay again.

Eve was such a gracious host!!  The gingerbread house is just as described and pictured!  Would recommend to anyone.  Just about a 30 min drive to anywhere and everywhere on the island which we really enjoyed as well!!

We LOVED our time at the gingerbread cottage! It was so warm and inviting and cozy. We also loved how private it felt. It was tucked away in a beautiful jungle surrounding with the most gorgeous foliage that took our breath away. Eve was so helpful and gave us directions to one of our favorite hikes we ever went on! It was well stocked with the essentials like bug spray, sunscreen, soaps, etc and it was so special to have our own little place in the jungles of Maui. We loved our time and would 100% recommend our friends to stay here :)
房屋在离机场不远的一座山上,周边有美丽的花园｡房间很漂亮,唯一额缺点是山上下雨较多,环境比较潮湿｡

Staying at the Gingerbread Cabin was an absolute dream. My wife and I booked the week about 6 months in advance and were treated so well from day 1. Eve and Steve were wonderful hosts. Eve extended every courtesy from the week before our arrival to our final departure. The cabin was fully stocked with everything two honeymooners could want and the kitchen was well equipped for cooking light meals throughout the week.
