The back patio was perfect for reading and eating breakfast in the lush garden environment. There is even a small stream running through the back of the spacious property. The entire place is set up for serenity and privacy.  For those of you who care about such things, the shower was AMAZING and easily fits 2 people. Everything about the stay was serene, romantic, and deeply peaceful. My wife and I wanted to explore Maui a bit and Eve was very prepared to recommend restaurants, excursions, massages (she has a massage therapist on location), and she even set up a snorkling tour of Molokini for us. We loved every minute of our stay. During the snorkling trip I met her husband Steve, the captain of the boat. He is a master of scuba diving and provides dive tours around the island as well. He was very nice and easy to talk to. All in all, my wife and I couldn't have been happier. If you are a party of two without children, this is the place for you.

We had a wonderful time at the 'Gingerbread House'! The photos are incredibly accurate--the space is cozy and lovely, the shower is great, the 'secret garden' and grounds are fantastic. Eve was great to work with and highly communicative, and helped us arrange a snorkeling trip in Kihei. I would highly recommend staying here if you are visiting Maui! It's also relatively close to Haleakala, a large volcano and national park on the island.

My wife and I stayed here for a few nights in the middle of our honeymoon. We thought a "jungle" getaway would be fun.

Pros: This property is absolutely beautiful. Picture perfect. The gardens surrounding are gorgeous and the house itself is adorable, as stated in the description. 

Cons: We realize that this is the jungle, however the listing said there would be Wi-Fi. Upon arrival, it was out and didn't start up until I had to find the router (next day), and reset it myself.

The biggest con, which actually caused my wife and I to leave a day early and go to a resort: CRITTERS! On our second night, we encountered two gecko lizards in the house as well as one of the largest spiders I have ever seen. Although gecko's inside a Hawaiian home are often considered good luck, I'm not sure we subscribe to that belief! 

If little things like that send shivers down your spine, stay far away from this place. If you're fine with roughing it and sharing the bed with someone, or something, other than your significant other, this is the place for you!

The gingerbread house is the perfect place to stay in Maui. The cabin itself is charming and comfortable and the location of the property is a perfect base to explore Maui. Eve is an amazing host; so warm, friendly and helpful. She gave us space but was always there when we needed her. She also helped us book a fantastic snorkelling tour and organised wonderful massage. I can't recommend the gingerbread house as a place to stay and Eve as a host highly enough! It will make your trip to Maui extra special.

We loved this little jungle cabin. Perfect size for two, well stocked, and though it is flanked by other buildings on the property, feels very private. All windows look out on unoccupied areas of the yard or lush foliage. A peaceful magical place.

The gingerbread house in Macawao was the perfect retreat away from the hustle and bustle of the coast. We were on our honeymoon and absolutely loved the cool, quiet and peaceful air we woke up to and came home to each day. It was nice to be able to cook our own meals. The cabin is beautiful and very efficiently laid out. The property is gorgeous! Eve welcomed us and gave us lots of information about the island of Maui. We loved our stay!

This was a beautiful, secluded, quiet, and lush cottage.  It was well appointed as well. Eve was responsive and friendly.  We didn't use the kitchen much but it would have been suitable to simple meal prep. The bathroom was well appointed though the shower seemed to run out of hot water at odd times..  Maybe it's hooked up to the same supplies as the other structures on the property or just has limited capacity. The wifi was dead, which was a letdown since the property has poor cell reception. In some regards that could be considered a good thing. Aside free on those minor grievances, the experience was wonderful.
I hope to stay here again and would recommend to friends.

We enjoyed our time at the gingerbread house and in Maui.  Steve connected with us and was helpful with additional information that we needed.  Bodhi greeted us within minutes. The location was perfect for us to branch out and explore the island.  We also enjoyed our visit to the sacred garden

Eve's place is absolutely amazing. The Gingerbread House is adorable and the perfect place to stay in Maui. The grounds are beautiful, peaceful and so much fun to explore. Everyone that works there is friendly and extremely helpful. We were able to explore the island as well, given the central location, and pretend like we were locals. :) We had such a great time. Thank you Eve!

This was the absolute best serene place we've been! The location was wonderful, secluded but still convenient to all of the wonderful sights of the island. Eve was a wonderful host and her Sacred  Garden was absolutely beautiful and inspiring! She had great insight to the activities around Maui without being intrusive. We loved all the little touches in the house and enjoyed our stay immensely! We'll definitely be back!

We thoroughly enjoyed Eve's cottage but could have used another day or so to explore the area and enjoy the gardens and immediate surroundings. The mosquitos were a bit bothersome when I tried to use the outside seating area to read, but this is a rainforest after all. Great location -- close to several good restaurants, access to the Hana Highway, and not far from Haleakala.

I loved the gingerbread cottage! Staying in Macawao was really special as well. The listing is very accurate and the cottage actually had more amenities than expected. How often does one find a complete kitchen set-up that includes a juicer? Eve was completely accessible to me for any questions or needs I had. She kept me informed of activities occurring around the site. I had family trying to talk me into staying closer to the beach and Eve suggested I might just enjoy the tropical, up-country tranquility. She was certainly right!

We had a lovely stay at this unique property in upcountry Maui. The rustic cottage is surrounded by jungle and has everything needed for a cozy few days on the island. Location is excellent and thankfully away from the touristy / package holiday stuff down along the coast. Eve was a great host and is very helpful and responsive.
Really beautiful house! Perfect location, too. It was really easy to get everywhere we needed to go.

We had an awesome stay at the gingerbread house! Eve was really welcoming, and even showed us around the Sacred Garden on the property - definitely take the time to check it out while you're there. The cottage itself is really cool, and had everything you could possibly need - including cookies! The location is ideal for getting anywhere on the island. We hope to stay here again someday.

We loved staying at the Gingerbread house. Everything about it was perfect - the fresh wood smell of the cabin, it was very clean, well decorated and came with everything you could possibly need (towels, bath amenities, boogie boards, etc.) for a fantastic week in Maui. Could not recommend this place more - Eve provided a ton of great recommendations for things to do/places to eat in the area, and the overview of the property was clear and helpful. Bodi (the extremely friendly dog on the property), even came by on our last day to say bye - Could not recommend more!

The gingerbread house was beyond cute. My husband and I stayed here for our wedding week. The house has everything you need and is conveniently located near the OGG airport, towns, beaches and major roads that will take you to the other sides of the island. There are adorable chickens and geckos outside of the house that add to the upcountry experience. Eve was an exceptional host. She was always so quick to respond and offer suggestions about anything on her property or the island. Eve ordained our wedding at her labyrinth in the next lot and allowed us to host the reception in her log cabin, which we rented for our family to stay in. Everyone fell in love with the gingerbread house. I can't get over how stinkin' cute it was. Thanks again, Eve.
Alles top!

This was such a lovely space. So much privacy in this oasis. My husband and I stayed here for a week during our adventures.  We were in and out but when we were on the property it just felt like home. We were greeted by some delish cookies too! The kitchen has tons of appliances too that we utilized. There were also some boogie boards + beach towels for your ocean adventures. You can also relax on the back patio where you can hear the amazing birds of Hawaii. Little bit of a walk to the stream as well. You are also on a sacred garden property that you can check out. Eve is an AMAZING host and such a sweetheart.

We've been eyeing this place for quite sometime, needless to say it didn't disappoint! Although we only stayed a day it was an amazing experience and we plan on returning next year! 

Eve was accommodating and knowledgable even with our short time frame while visiting. The place was so clean and well stocked with anything you could need. Cute decor and love the seclusion.

Eve also greeted us and she's even more beautiful in person. The grounds are impressive and the garden was stunning, only a few feet from the front door of the cabin. Pictures really don't do it justice. 

Thanks for accommodating us with your prompt replies and getting us booked in even for the day that you were able to squeeze us in. We hope to see you again soon!!

Our time at Eve's Gingerbread House was great. Even though we didn't meet her personally, Eve has been very responsive and very helpful. Check-in and check-out went absolutely smooth. You need to be aware that this is a special place...right in the middle of nature with humidity, animal noises etc coming with it, but we loved it very much. It is a clean, beautiful and very very cozy place to spend your time in central Maui with Road to Hana, Haleakala and North Shore surfing close by. Mahalo, Eve!

Beautiful, quiet, and cozy. Much needed relaxation time after coming from the hustle of Oahu. Eve and Steve were helpful and easy to work with. We loved walking the grounds and the quaint serenity of the cottage.

Eve's place was secluded and private and on a really lovely property. The house was as described and very clean! The outside seating area was also really nice, but definitely bring bug spray! It's pretty centrally located for a lot of spots on the island but it was at least a 25 minute drive to most places we wanted to go. The only thing that was kind of a bummer was there was no cell service (we have AT&T) and the wifi was also down and we weren't able to connect to any of the other wifis on the property. If you're looking for something off the grid, this is a great spot!
This was a nice, private and well-equipped place to get away and relax.

This was a lovely place to stay in Maui. I truly adored it and was enchanted by the magnificent foliage surrounding the cottage. I could never have believed it would be so beautiful. The cottage itself was lovely as well, very cozy and had everything we needed in the kitchen, for the beach,etc. It was even better than the pictures, and even more inviting. Eve was also super sweet and helpful, giving us directions to the local markets and restaurants. 

Only a few minor inconveniences. One was that the listing says there is wifi...there isn't any working wifi in the actual house. Annoyance for us, but could be a make or break for others. Second, the shower is an 'eco' shower, and is only hot for 6 minutes, then it runs cold and gets hot again in 10 minutes. Once I figured out how to lower the stream pressure, and wash fast, it was fine. Kinda a bummer though because when I'm on vacation I like to be in there a little longer and not feel rushed.... AND had to experience a very cold shower before I learned. All well, I would stay here again, so very minor. :)
Eve was great and the cabin adorable. We kept to ourselves for the most part, as we were in a romantic getaway. Any guide we did have questions or need anything Eve was there to help out. Thanks Eve!

Our stay was absolutely wonderful!  Perfectly located, we were in a lush little jungle! The sacred garden was beautiful and I would not hesitate to visit again anytime we are in the area. Eve was so wonderful and we are blessed to have been married by her in the garden. we will never forget this vacation!

We had a great time staying at the Garden Gingerbread House.  The place was just like the pictures, except even more beautiful in person.  I traveled with my wife and two young kids (1 and 3 yrs old) and it was the perfect size.  The kids loved exploring the "jungle" outside of the cottage.

Eve was a great host....she gave us a tour of the property, answered all questions, and was helpful if we needed anything.  She had a pack-and-play for us to use, along with beach towels and other items.  She was very nice and easy to talk to.

We thought the property was at a great location.  Although it's in the rainforest, it was easily accessible to many places on the island.  It was close to the airport, local towns like Paia, some beaches, and the Road to Hana.  Getting over to west or south Maui was around 45 minutes, but it went by fast with the great scenery.  We love going to the beach, but it was so nice going back to the property at night and waking up there in the morning.

I can't even think of any complaints.  I would definitely stay here again!

This is an amazing retreat in the jungle. It is a great stepping off point to Haleakala, paia, road to Hana. Eve was a great host and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay on Maui. Make sure to take the time to experience the gardens and labyrinths.

We had a wonderful stay at the cottage.  Eve and Steve welcomed us on arrival, showed us around the place and made sure we had everything we needed.  The location is conveniently located between Paia/Haiku/Makawao, so if you plan on exploring upcountry Maui this is a great option.  Keep in mind that you are definitely in "real nature" - very tropical, with bugs, wild chickens, and other crawly creatures, so if that isn't your bag this place probably won't be a great fit.  We loved it though.  The cottage itself was adorable and impeccably clean and updated, exactly like the pictures.  It came fully stocked with basic cooking supplies, beach toys, and a super helpful guidebook that Eve put together.  Wi-Fi wasn't working when we were there and cell reception was spotty at best, but that was the case for a lot of places on the east side of the island.  And to be honest, it was actually really nice to feel a bit disconnected from the outside world for a while.  I also can't forget to mention Bodhi, the largest and most lovable dog you'll ever meet - definitely give his booty a rub if you see him.  Can't wait to return!

We had a great stay here! Great location for exploring upcountry and getting on the road to Hana. We were greeted when we checked in and felt very welcome. Loved the bathroom! Felt very secluded but still close enough to restaurants and things to do!
We had a wonderful time staying in this amazing little cottage. Eve was such a great host. The grounds are beautiful and stopping by the Sacred Garden is a must.
Wonderful stay!! The chickens and roosters were so friendly and cute!! It was perfectly quiet and secluded!

We rented the Gingerbread House for five nights during our stay in Maui. The cottage is charming and Eve welcomed us warmly right away. The space had a variety of great conveniences (big fridge, microwave, coffee maker with yummy coffee provided.) The house was clean and well decorated. For a couple the bed was a good size, but not super supportive (if you need a firmer bed). Unfortunately, the week we were in Maui there was an excessive amount of rain resulting in a lot of mud on the property and a sort of constant dampness in the older cottage. The major problem was a lack of internet connection. There is a LINKSYS router in the cottage but it never had a reliable connection to the internet. I was able to load no more than a couple webpages at random in total. Troubleshooting/restarting the router didn't help. This was a pretty significant bummer when trying to plan your day before leaving the house since we also didn't have any cell coverage (AT&T iPhone 7s). According to some previous reviews this is a persistent problem. You could find it on certain parts of the property, but rain & mud made that a bit tricky/inconvenient. Of course, we know no one can control the weather, but if we’re being honest, it put a damper on our stay here, leaving us with a fairly neutral experience. That being said, Eve herself was a lovely host offering tips, helping deliver a package we had to have sent to the house and allowing us to do laundry. If you’re looking to really “get away from it all” the Gingerbread House is a great spot for you and it is conveniently located to the airport, Road to Hana, Paia, Upcountry and even the Wailea area.
A great place to stay if you want some privacy and a cozy living space.

Eve's place was awesome! We're now on Kauai and we can't stop thinking about the gingerbread house. Gorgeous scenery, beautiful house, great location and yet still the absolute best place to get away from everything.

It was exactly as described but better! Eve has thought of everything. There's a guidebook, beach towels, shampoo/conditioner, Hawaii coffee, cookies, and all basic cooking necessities. 

If we make it back to Maui, I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else. Loved it!
This place is great. The room is super cute and has everything we needed. If the wifi could be fixed then it would be more perfect.

Wonderful Gingerbread cottage. A great place for 2pp to stay and highly recommend it. Very secluded but yet lots to do in the area. Eve is wonderful; full of helpful information. Her Sacred Garden is a "must-see". Loved, loved, loved our week there...

We stayed here for out wedding weekend, great location. Rented the log house for our friends and family, it was in one word amazing. The pictures she has of the place are beautiful but short of experiencing it in real life. 11/10 definitely worth every penny, the sacred garden next door was also beautiful. The list goes on and on! Book it!

This place is so cool! Fruit trees, sacred spaces, a river that runs behind the property and plenty of privacy. 
Eve was super sweet and helpful with any of our needs, questions and concerns. 
My partner and I stayed in the ginger bread house for 3 nights. It was perfect for us because we had already spent 10 days on the island and just wanted time to relax. The wifi wasn't the best but we didn't mind at all. It forced us to go outside and actually relax without the distraction of technology. She provides a DVD tv and DVDs for entertainment if needed. 
My partner and I caught Eves full moon labyrinth session last night and it was really inspiring to hear her talk and to walk the labyrinth. The sacred garden is truly a special place. I highly recommend it. 
I wish we could have stayed longer. It's in a great location close to everything but far away enough you don't get stuck in traffic. We can not wait to return!

My wife and I spent the last week at the gingerbread house and had, by far, the best vacation of our lives. When we arrived, we were promptly greeted by Eve and one of the members of her cleaning staff. The property was ready right when we arrived. We talked with Eve and she showed us around the property. We quickly learned that what we read in the great reviews would be confirmed. She walked us around and showed us the fruit trees and said we were welcome to help ourselves to all of the fruit growing nearby. The tangerines were perfect and the lemons were HUGE (great for morning lemon water). The property includes a large house, the gingerbread house, Eve and Steve's house, and the Sacred Garden of Maliko (hope I'm spelling that correctly). Though there were other people renting the larger house next door and Eve and her husband were close by, we definitely felt that there was plenty of privacy. Eve was very clear that if we needed anything, we could contact her right away and she would respond, but that she wanted to give us our privacy otherwise. We did contact her a few times during our stay and she responded instantly. The gingerbread house is absolutely perfect for couples. It is very spacious on the inside and quite stylishly designed. The bed and sheets are totally comfortable and the bathroom has much more space than it appears from the online images. It is great that you can rent this property for less than a standard hotel room in Lahaina considering it is so much larger and more convenient. One item from the previous reviews that concerned us a little before we arrived was that the wifi did not work very well on the property. I will say that the first few days we were here, we could not get any wifi or data connection in the gingerbread house. I was able to walk a few steps to a small gazebo area, though, where the wifi was strong enough to send some emails. To ease future travelers' worries, I am pleased to report that in the middle of our stay, we received a message from Eve that the wifi in the gingerbread house had been fixed. When we returned, we found that the connection was lightning fast. We were able to easily use it for browsing and email and we even found that we could connect to netflix without any problems at all. The best part of staying on this property was the location. You can't possibly find a place to rent on Maui that is more central than this. It is definitely a bit further from Lahaina if you are more interested in hanging out at the beach every day (though Kihei is only about 20-30 minutes compared to Lahaina, which is more like 50-60), but everything else you would want to do on Maui is much closer to Makawao. Getting to the road...

This place is magical.  We had such a wonderful stay, I don't even know how to put it into words.  Lots of nature, lots of wildlife, it felt like camping!!  The kitchen is well equipped but small, definitely served our purpose for whipping up quick breakfasts before we headed out for the day.  So relaxing and all kinds of fruits etc to gather and enjoy!  We loved picking fresh tangerines and avocados!!
This spot is paradise. Fresh fruits on the trees, a nice stream, and cute chickens. Just know that it is a 30 minute drive from any beaches. The drive is beautiful.
Perfect in every way!
Clean and comfortable.  Very quaint and efficient use of space.  Everything you could need was provided.  Unbelievable setting!

Very sweet and private location. Great for those interested in a private stay in Maui. If you want to cook at home, note that kitchenette is quite small and the counter-top hot plate is less to optimal. We found the bed to be too soft, but if that is what you like, then you are in luck. The entire place was very clean, and it was nice to sit outside on the back patio eating breakfast in the morning sun or enjoying a glass of wine in the evening (although the mosquitoes make the late afternoon and evening less than optimal).
Over-all good to very-good, and potentially better depending on your preferences and requirements.

02/08 to 02/11/17. The jungle setting is very beautiful and peaceful with many interesting birds and plants, including many fruit trees. The house is small and clean. The bed is soft and comfortable. Eve is gracious and kind. We would not hesitate to go back to Gingerbread House.
A ver cozy cottage!
Beautiful Location, great host, everything very tidy and just perfect!
The gingerbread house is a super cute little cottage in the middle of an amazing magical garden! Eve was wonderful if helping us get settled in. The space was clean, and the nature was beautiful!

This is the most beautiful little place to stay imaginable. The owners are so kind , helpful and friendly and we were so happy to experience a slice of heaven in these exotic and abundant surroundings.

Eve was a great host and the place was exactly as described. It is in the middle of a jungle and is a bit of a drive the the popular west and south sides of the island, perfect location for the Road to Hana and some of the smaller towns in the Upcountry. Because it's in the middle of a jungle there are wildlife which I think Eve mentions in the description, roosters crowing, little critters making noises and lots of birds and such. The hot water is a little short sided but that might depend on how many other occupants are on the property, the week we were there it was full. There is a washer/dryer that was handy, a small blow dryer, an iron and beach towels available as well as anything you'd need in a kitchen. Overall, it was a great experience and we'd stay again.

There is nowhere better if you wish for some peace in the countryside where the only sounds are the wind in the trees and the sound of the birds.

A charming house and charming hosts who are always available to answer queries but never intrusive.

Totally recommended.

The Gingerbread Cottage is a charming, clean, quiet, and peaceful little house in the middle of a very unique, rainforest property.  We thought the cottage was the perfect home base for exploring every inch of Maui.
The cottage was visually appealing and well kept.  The aromatic cedar paneling throughout the house gives a rustic appeal; the bathroom is pure modern pleasure! 
The property around the cottage is fascinating; lush and full of an amazing variety of plants and trees.  There are bananas, tangerines, lemons, papayas, coconuts, and more—and you are encouraged to taste-test what you find!  Eve and Steve shared an avocado with us, grown on the property.  The avocado was as big as our four fists put together and tasted like butter.  Yummy!  Speaking of Eve and Steve (and Bodhi)…very welcoming, laid back, accomplished individuals!  They are so generous to share their lovely property with those of us lucky enough to happen upon it.  We would stay again, in a heartbeat.
Final note:  some have commented that the eco-water heater is less than ideal, but we had no problems at all with the amount or temperature of the water during our showers.

Eve's place was a dream - the highlight of our stay in Maui. We loved every minute here and Eve did an incredible job to make our stay as perfect as possible. The cottage was equipped with everything we could need, the bed was incredibly comfortable, Eve gave amazing suggestions about things to do and places to eat, and the location was central, away from tourists and a dream. It was stunningly beautiful and relaxing to stay in the jungle and I highly recommend this to anyone!

The cottage was beautiful and clean, well appointed and open-feeling with lots of windows looking into the tropical yard and all the amenities one needs. (Microwave,coffee maker,hair dryer,fridge,rice cooker, blender, juicer, ample lighting options, and guest robes.) The trees and landscape and lush meadow provide amazing photo opps. The property includes The Sacred Garden, a serene greenhouse, shop, and walking labyrinths with a calming Zen essence, wonderful staff and smart African Grey parrot. We definitely plan a return visit in hopes that the stream will be running! Eve is a gracious hostess who responded immediately to every request.

The Gingerbread Cottage is quaint, clean, and charming. Had all the room we needed in a beautiful private jungle setting. A great off-the-beaten-path alternative to the resort approach To Hawaiian vacationing

We chose the cottage as a place to stay central in east Maui and loved staying here! Everything was perfect from the moment we arrived (our only request for next time is extra visits from Bodhi the dog!). The house was easy to find, check in was simple, Eve met us in person and gave a detailed intro to the house and property. The home was beautiful, clean, smelled wonderful, and had everything available that you would need including beach towels, umbrella, styrofoam cooler, coffee pot, fridge, toaster oven, working internet and cell phone service. The property is quiet and beautiful. It was about an hour's drive to the top of Haleakala. Thank you for making our stay great!

Wow, this place was awesome.  We stayed in the gingerbread house for our honeymoon and loved it.  If you're looking to stay off the beaten path on Maui, this is your place.  Away from the touristy crowds of West Maui, the house is secluded and among beautiful greenery in the upcountry.  It's close the the tiny town of Makawao, a hidden gem, with cute shops and restaurants.  Eve was so accommodating and the house was equipped with everything we needed.  There are numerous chickens roaming the property, so be aware that there may be some early morning wakeup calls!

Great location for exploring Maui's upcountry. Beautiful grounds with fruit trees, creek, nursery/garden and a labyrinth! Bed was extra soft and comfortable. Large bathroom. Great lighting and lots of windows.

The highlight of our stay.  Beautiful and cozy wee house, all the comforts we required, gorgeous peaceful jungly yard with wonderful strolling areas and a burbling creek. Friendly-neighbour chickens to share our afternoon lounging.  Wholly secluded, yet only a short drive to central/north coast centres.  If we return to Maui, timing will depend on being able to stay here again.
Small private getaway.  Steve did an amazing job with the bath and shower. Quiet and naturally beautiful.

Beautiful house , great location and an amazing host. 
Clean and tidy, small house- but has everything you need.
Definitely worth trying out!
This was a gorgeous place to stay for our three nights in Maui. A great location to explore the island from. Clean and convenient!

Beautiful is not what makes this place special.  Sure, it’s gorgeous, but gorgeous is what Maui is supposed to be about.  For my Jennie and me, the thing that made this gingerbread house so memorable was the way we transformed between arrival and departure.  

We came preoccupied and left at peace.  

Much of this can be attributed to the little gingerbread house itself (for which you will find reviews aplenty herein), but the true difference was Eve and her little labyrinth.  We came and experienced the unexpected and departed more than we were.  I can’t promise the same for you, but I can, and do hope.

My wife and I decided to celebrate our 35 year anniversary in Maui. My son told us about Airbnb as an alternative to hotels. We'll most likely never do hotels again after our stay here at the Gingerbread. Eve is such a great host and made us feel at home here. This is one place we will surely visit again.

Eve was an amazing host. Quick to meet us at the property, gave us pointers as to how we could maximize our stay. It was apparent that Eve takes a great deal of pride in the property, and without question this shows. The home was quaint but perfect for two. We treated this as a home base as we embarked on adventures on the island. We would stay here again, and gladly recommend others to do the same.

My husband and I had a wonderful stay. Our experience on Maui was definitely enhanced by the charm of the gingerbread house. The serenity and comfortably cooler climate upcountry was a nice change from the hustle and bustle and heat along the beaches in Kaanapali. The property itself is very peaceful as a place to relax and tune out the world. It is exactly the place to retreat if you are looking for a setting that will help keep your "real world" stresses from finding you on the island.  While we found the property serene, we did not find it too isolated. We found it conveniently located for exploring all over the island. I would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Maui.

This is a quiet and secluded retreat for a couple to escape from the hubbub of civilization. However, the center of town is a short drive away to enjoy a satisfying meal and basic food supplies. The gingerbread house itself is immaculate and clean with a comfortable bed, modern shower stall.

If you are looking to experience Maui as part of a spiritual respite, or are just seeking quiet, comfortable and quality lodgings away from the frenetic energy and noise of tourist hotels, then look no further than the Adorable Garden Gingerbread House. It is the place for you. Our four day stay was excellent in every respect.  Eve and Steven are great hosts, and just about anything you might need during your stay is provided in the cottage, which is located in Maui's uplands, about 15-20 minutes from Paia and Haiku.  The cottage is warm and welcoming, plenty of room for couples.  You'll have decent wi-fi access (we streamed a Netflix movie one rainy night) and access to the jungle like grounds. The adjacent Sacred Garden and labyrinth(s) are a must do.  Eve and Steve are warm and exceptionally welcoming people/hosts, who were available to answer questions and  helped set up massages, readings and a tour of the Island's spiritual sites with community practitioners. Yes, it is a working place, so you will also be experiencing roosters, chickens and the occasional visit by the biggest and friendliest dog you've ever seen. We loved it and are already planning our return experience.

Great spot in upcountry Maui. My wife and I wanted a place that was away from the hustle & bustle of the touristy spots, which is exactly what this offers! It's an easy drive to any of the beach areas (10-45 min depending on where you want to go), and only 15 minutes or so from the airport. We would stay here again.

Our stay at the gingerbread house is one to remember! The garden setting is a picture of beauty and serenity; perfect for what my husband and I were looking for on our honeymoon. It felt like we had our own slice of paradise to ourselves; almost right on the path to the famous road to Hana. The house was clean, and stocked with all kinds of thoughtful goodies. You won't be running out to Long's Store every day, maybe just a quick trip to the store for some food beforehand and you're set! So many fun things to do at the garden, so, be sure to schedule in some time to check everything out :). A big mahalo to Eve and Steve, Thank you!

The gingerbread house is more than we expected. The surroundings are very peaceful. It is a welcome change from staying on the beach. Yet the beaches are fairly close, as are many upcountry sites. You can enjoy the best of both worlds with this house.

Your little gingerbread house was just stunning and so cozy! 
The grounds at the Sacred Garden and rest of the property was amazing and so zen. It completely helps with tying to find that relaxing time. ♥️
Thank you again for our stay with you. It was just what Andrew and I needed, to be able to unplug and just get away from everyone. If we come back to Maui, I know where will be will be staying ♥️

The gingerbread house was absolutely amazing! So cozy, romantic, and just what we were looking for our honeymoon. We loved waking up and being able to listen to the sounds of nature and looking up at the greenery and sky through the high picture windows. Eve was such a wonderful host, so sweet and helpful. We did not want to leave this zen retreat! The location is secluded yet SO close to beaches, delicious food and nightlife in Paia, scenery and adventures are just in reach through Makawao, Haiku, and Kula. I know we will be thinking about our stay at the Sacred Garden for years to come. We will be back without a second thought! Mahalo ❤️
Great place! Got to see the tropical side of Maui!

Gorgeous, lush property! Feels very secluded but is not far from town. Location was central to the many activities we planned that were spread out on the island. We had a moderate drive to most of our destinations. The perfect blend of convenience and solitude. 

I was travelling with my 12 year old son, but this would also be a nice choice for couples. Quiet, beautiful property, nice breezes,  the wonderful sound of rain on the tile roof, sounds of nature. The time we spent just lounging in our room was far more relaxing than a hotel room or condo could have been. 

For me the lack of air conditioning was not ideal. Being from Texas I am accustomed to enduring much hotter temperatures than Maui also with very high humidity. But I am a person who likes my indoor climate cool and comfy. I do not put on a sweater or jacket at the hint of temps below 70 degrees. The indoors was certainly tolerable. I was never uncomfortable. Especially when I was able to open both doors for nice cross ventilation. But if there had been A/C I would have run it at times. If you prefer your space well conditioned this could be a consideration. 

Overall, wonderful trip, great property, and an accomodating host!

Perfect place to get away and unwind. My wife and I love the proximity to the towns of Paia and Makawao and it was a super easy jumping off point for our drive to Hana and some great hiking. Eve was super nice and made us feel very welcome, she even gave us a tour of the property (which is huge) and showed us some of the cool things onsite, like fruit trees and the sacred garden. Would definitely stay here again!

Bon emplacement pour découvrir l'île. Logement atypique et agréable. Chez Eve, vous serez dans une cabane au milieu d'un jardin tropical. Eve est une hôte attentionnée et qui aime faire découvrir son univers. Merci encore c'était super !

Eve's house was amazing. We ended our 10 day honeymoon here and couldn't have been happier. Great change from the city or resort feel, yet close to everything. Beautiful views just outside for breakfast and coffee. Eve was also a great host. Very welcoming and accommodating. Book this place if you can!
Wonderful wonderful wonderful! What a lovely Maui experience at the Gingerbread Cottage. Eve is the best host!!

We loved our stay at the Gingerbread Cottage. Nestled on Eve's beautiful property, the cottage is among fruit trees and next to a nice garden center. We enjoyed the roosters and the big friendly dog, as well as fresh papaya from the garden. Wonderful place!
Great location, amazing details and the best hospitality!
Very spiritual place. Cozy little house with decent equipment. Great for a layover.
Great stay! Quiet, relaxing and just the perfect place if you want to disconnect from the world, especially coming from Honolulu. Cottage was clean and had almost all amenities one could think of.

this charming house is the ideal place to find serenity and calm. isolated place in a very natural environment. the welcome was very warm. the house is very clean with all the necessary convenience to spend a pleasant time. I recommend this place for a discovery of the true nature of maui.

Eve was out of town and we worked with Fiona during our stay. Fiona was kind and very helpful, greeting us when we arrived and offering help and assistance when we needed it. The house is cute, we enjoyed how secluded it was and the pretty views out the windows. The property has a ton of fruit trees and chickens and roosters. We should note the roosters crow at any time day or night, but they were usually relatively quiet until dawn. I used ear plugs which helped. We also visited the Sacred Garden and enjoyed the peaceful greenhouse and walked the labyrinth. Truly a unique experience which added to our trip to Maui. Also note, the wifi is not very reliable and I would consider yourself unplugging for a few days while you are staying there.  We were there at a rainy part of the season as well and it rained a fair bit the whole three days of our stay.  I don't think we realized we would need to prepare for rain but you are in essentially a rainforest at this location, just something to be aware of.

Eve has a wonderful place to hang out for a while... laid back and low key.
Makawoa and Haiku have great restaurants and boutique shops.
The location is fabulous for exploring the rest of the island.

You will love this place especially if you like a cottage cabin type living. My girlfriend and I had a great time. Its beautiful and you definitely get the real Hawaiian experience of how it might feel to live there on Maui. We didn't want to leave.
Loved the little cottage and happy with our choice to stay here. Eve was great at communicating and we wouldn’t change a thing about our stay.

This is a cozy property that serves as a great starting point for exploring the Road to Hana, Paia, and Makawao. While a studio, the space is adequate even with large suitcases and we appreciated the chest of drawers in the bathroom so we could strategize our unpacking. As mentioned in the description, this is a working farm and as such, roosters do crow. They didn’t bother us particularly but if you are one to sleep in late, keep this in mind. The property is lovely and many locals knew the Sacred Garden and had wonderful things to say about the labyrinth and succulents. We had wonderful meals in the area and would recommend the Gingerbread House as a base in Upcountry Maui.
This is a wonderful place for R and R! It was scenic and beautiful. The grounds were just exquisite! Eve was a wonderful host! I could not have asked for more! I will definitely be back!

The Gingerbread house was definitely one of the highlights of our trip!

My wife and I split our honeymoon into two parts (which we highly recommend). The first part was our stay on the Hana side of Maui in the gingerbread house and the second part was on the resort side in Lahaina. Being on the Hana side of the island for a few days was breathtaking! It is so lush, green, and beautiful! 

The Gingerbread house sits amongst the beautiful lushness of Maui's east side. It is secluded, and quiet. The property is on an acre or so of lush green gardens and we were even lucky enough to see the stream come in the back of the property! 

If you want a place that is away from all of the tourists, is quiet, peaceful, and beautiful (think Jurassic Park lush green), than this place is it!

There are two things that are worth noting. 1. There are chickens and roosters on the property. Maui's east side is full of animal life, cows, horses, and chickens (you will find wild chickens everywhere). So this is to be expected and really does add to the ambiance of you being in the environment. We enjoyed it.
2. There are two other homes on the property, but we never ran into anyone or were disturbed in any way by others. Again, this place is quiet and private, but you are not the only one on these couple acres.

I thought those two things were worth mentioning. They are not downsides! Just information to help your decision, that's why you're reading this review isn't it?

We loved our stay here and would highly recommend it! Plus, Eve is excellent at communicating and so so hospitable! 
It was a pleasure staying here!

This was the cutest little place and on an amazing piece of land. Everything was beautiful and Eve and her husband were super nice. I will for sure be back and I am already telling everyone that I know.

Wow, what a great place this is. The apartment is AMAZING, it's just like the photos, and you're in the middle of this rainforest oasis that's very quiet. It was such a relaxing place to stay. Eve was fantastic, I always heard back from her right away, and even though we had some problems with our flights getting us to Maui, she was super flexible with when we got in and made sure things worked out for us.

We can't wait to come back!

The gingerbread house was the best decision we made on our trip to Maui!! Eve was the most gracious and considerate host. The location is central enough that it is very easy to get to any part of the island, but secluded enough where you don't feel like a tourist. The house was so comfortable and had everything we needed to cook in if we wanted or to just relax. The property is so beautiful. I recommend picking fresh citrus and have coffee by the stream each morning. This place is really the perfect peaceful retreat to get away from it all. We thoroughly enjoy our stay here and cannot wait to return!!

Incredibly unique place in the Maui jungle. Comfortable bed and lots of amenities- laundry supplies, kitchenette, beach gear, etc. Nearby Makawao is a great town and it’s not far to Baldwin Beach. Eve is helpful and has an awesome spot called Sacred Garden next door. Overall I recommend it and would stay again!

Eve is a great host. I loved everything about the gingerbread cottage and the surrounding environment. If you desire a relaxing escape from the sometimes hectic pace in today’s society, look no further than what Eve has to offer. After an adventurous day exploring the rest of Maui, this is an (Website hidden by Airbnb) oasis where you can find true inner peace and be “one” with nature. You won’t be disappointed. You will leave with a better appreciation of what “Aloha” really means.

The Gingerbread House is quaint, quiet and the quintessential hideout from the tourist scene. You can visit Lahaina’s resorts and old town, but retreat to Eve’s Sacred Garden for respite. Makawao, Haiku, Paeia, and Kula are close as are great beaches like Hookipu and the Haleakala climb.
Great location with a magical quality about it.  Lots of citrus trees and we were welcome to pick beautiful, sweet tangerines.
Awesome place to stay. Was homey and perfect.
Eve has an amazing house. She is thoughtful, with lots of information on the island and always willing to help. Great and quick responses as well!

Joni Mitchell wrote in her song, Woodstock, about getting ourselves back to the garden. This retreat does just that. It is a perfect place to decompress from our 21st century lives. The cottage is perfect for learning how simple life can be.you are surrounded  by natural beauty and an abundance of fruit trees which your host, Eve, shares with guests. We found it a perfect place to relax after our travel fom the east coast of the USA. The body has a chance to acclimate to natural rhythms, and the mind drifts away.  If you need to shop, dine out, etc. you are minutes from that as well. The cottage is well stocked, clean, and has ample utility to prepare simple meals. Only the cook top was a bit small for our liking, as we enjoy preparing most of our own dinners.

The Gingerbread House really is 'adorable'. The space is perfectly furnished and  accomodates everything you could possibly need. Eve was a great host and communication was easy. The Sacred Garden next-door is such a lovely chilled place to spend some time. We had expected not to be able to spend evenings outside because of the mozzies but we seemed to be lucky and found there were very few so we enjoyed a glass of wine down by the river bed watching the wild roosters and birds.
We loved shopping for food at Mana Foods in Pa'ia and particularly the General Store at Makawao where we seemed to find more local produce. It's easy to reach the Haleakala crater and Hana Road from here.
Nice and quiet, we love the up country.

Eve's Garden Gingerbread House was the perfect place for our Maui getaway! Eve is an amazing host and was super fast to respond if we had any questions. She had amazing recommendations for things to do near the house and around Maui. We would definitely stay here again!

Eve’s property is a beautiful retreat and a great place to disconnect from stressors. The space was perfect for two adults looking to relax and explore Upcountry. While the timing never worked out for us to meet in person, Eve was always very responsive to us via message. Definitely recommend!

Home was just as photographed and beautiful. Eve had a great binder with helpful tips and information about the local area. Home was stocked with plenty of sunblock and bug spray for use. It was a very peaceful and relaxing stay. Would highly recommend staying here!

Eve's place was comfortable, clean, and in a perfect location near Paia. She provided all the beach gear we needed, plenty of towels, and an umbrella for sudden rain showers! We loved our stay, and would highly recommend. Look forward to returning to Maui soon!

I loved staying at Eve's beautiful home.  It is well appointed, with everything you can think of - perfectly clean, with plenty of towels, plenty of beach gear, delicious coffee for the morning, and a perfect bed.  There is a lovely porch behind the house to spend blissful mornings, and the delight of being woken at first light by roosters, and going to sleep under a thousand stars was magical. Everything has been thought of.  The town of Makawao is wonderful to explore, and the Forest Reserve Loop hike is heaven.  The house is perfectly situated both to explore Maui's spectacular upcountry, or take a swim on some pretty special beaches.   If you do manage to leave the property (which is a challenge as the idea of curling up in one of the well-placed adirondack chairs at the stream bed outside your door is hard to resist), Eve's guidebook is really helpful, with great directions to everything you'll want to do / go / be near / see.  Pro tip - be sure to stock up on papayas at the General Store because you won't want to leave!  Thank you!!!!!!!!
Do not hesitate. Eve was amazing, the cottage was glorious. An absolutely stunning property

Schnuckliges kleines Häuschen mit tropischem Garten und sehr liebevoller Dekoration in ruhiger Umgebung.
Eve ist eine sehr nette und besorgte Gastgeberin, welche stets um unser Wohl besorgt war.
Wir hatten einen sehr angenehmen Aufenthalt und würden jederzeit wiederkommen!

My stay at the Gingerbread House was amazing.  I loved that it was off the beaten path, but still close to anything you would want to do or see.  Eve was especially wonderful and provided excellent advice regarding places to eat and sights to see.  I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay.

This was one of the best accommodations we had on Maui!  The space is beautifully designed, very clean, and has a lot of great amenities including washer and drier, BBQ, fully stocked kitchen, and even a juicer for when you accidentally buy way too much tropical fruit.  The property itself is gorgeous and we had a lot of fun exploring the Sacred Garden next door.  Eve was a wonderful host and was always just a text message away if we needed anything.  I highly recommend this place!

Eve was very welcoming. The grounds are beautiful and relaxing. Many chickens and roosters running around. The cottage is very cute and cozy, in a great secluded location that’s very beautiful in the mountains. Eve had great recommendations for food and hikes. We had a great stay here!

The Gingerbread cottage is a wonderful getaway located in upcountry Makawao. From the moment you step inside you immediately know that this is a very special place. Just outside the backdoor is a small patio area with table and chairs, and a free standing chiminea fire pit.
    Outside you are surrounded by lush forest, plants and fruit trees. A stream flows through the property depending on the amount of rain received. It is is both peaceful and relaxing. Inside, a gentle breeze comes in through the windows throughout the day. On a cloud free and moonless night you can see lots of stars through a large picture window above the kitchen area. 
    One point of interest is a painting of Jimi Hendrix hanging in the bathroom. Rumor has it that he once stayed there while filming Rainbow Bridge. Ask Eve about that! There is no television but you won't miss it. It's a vacation after all. Everything else is there that you could possibly need. 
    Warning. There are a lot of roosters on the island (there seems to be three for every hen) and you will hear them crowing not just in the morning but also at night. The sound carries in a eerily way so if this is a deal breaker then you may want to stay in a hotel on another island. 
    Finally, this is our second stay here and we plan on coming again. You will find that Eve is a delightful host with a cheery smile! She greeted us with open arms and made us feel both welcome and at home. Mahalo!

This spot is a little jungle oasis. You are surrounded by nature, fall asleep to the crickets and wake up to birds singing. it’s very lush and centrally located on the island. Everything you need for a break from the real world can be found here!
The best air bnb I have gone to. Spot on with everything. If we can do it again, we would go with Eve and her beautiful gingerbread house! 6 stars!!!
Quiet comfortable cabin in serene jungle setting. A visit to the sacred garden next door is a must.

AMAZING PLACE TO STAY! 

If you are looking for a nice quiet spot not too far from all the great things Maui has to offer... this is your spot.

Secluded little garden cottage for a romantic stay with your partner... we had a lovely time here. Highly suggest for couples planning to stay in the area.

Our stay was too short and we didn't manage to explore and enjoy everything around the cabin. I definitely recommend that you leave some free time for hanging out around Eve's property. When staying there you are not just booking a place to sleep - it is a whole experience package! Everything was perfect!

My wife and I spent our honeymoon here. We truly loved it! Eve was helpful on finding the place (some construction going on caused some confusion). Eve also provided a binder that gave great local suggestions for all sorts of different things (I.e. food, beaches, hikes). The cottage was a cozy little place perfect for two people, and only 10-15 min from the beach and town. My wife and I also loved the chickens! They were super friendly and fun to watch and listen to. W head a great time and would definitely recommend this place to anyone!

Every bit as good as all the other positive reviews suggest. We were delighted by what we saw as we arrived at our cosey cottage at 11pm. Great location for exploring the haleakala crater and for getting to see Paia. Also proved a great spot for when we left to journey the road to Hana. Eve was a  lovely host..full of useful tips such as her reassurance that taking the coastal route back from Hana is perfectly safe (we are so glad we did as it has stunning coastal views). A very enjoyable 3 night stay.

The review of our experience at Eve's place can only be very positive. We thoroughly enjoyed our first trip to up country rather than spend all our time as usual at busy beach resorts. What an eye opening experience of time to be spent on the island. Our choice to try One of Eve's cottages, in this case the Gingerbread House, was the highlite of our long trip. Her Photos and explanation of of the property were right on but being there yourself is something else! The peaceful surroundings, island feel, and beauty everywhere you look (or wonder) was really special. The location, next door to The Sacred Garden and short drive to the small local villages was an experience we WILL revisit and we WILL reach out to Eve for accomidation. For us, Eve's Up Country Gingerbread House is JUST what we needed, and didn't even know! Give something besides the beaches a go for once. You will NOT be disappointed. A GREAT getaway here.....and she has others just as fine too! We loved it

My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and loved it! 

Eve was a great host and left plenty of information regarding the home and it’s surrounding areas, which made our stay very easy. There is no tv, but we didn’t mind at all since we spent most of our days out of the house exploring the island and by the time we got back we wanted to relax and sleep. Eve provided plenty of towels, extra linens, beach essentials, yummy coffee and cookies, as well as plates, utensils, pots, pans, mugs and cups. There is a microwave, table-top toaster oven and hot plate with 2 burners in case you wanted to cook at the house. Pretty much anything you may need! 

The property was beautiful and the Sacred Garden is a must visit! We will definitely be back someday.
Amazing place to stay!! Eve and her Husband are awesome. I'm planning to go back in the future and I'm looking forward to it again.   I highly recommend this place. Mahalo for everything!!! :)

The Gingerbread House was so charming and a perfect way to end our time in Maui. Upon check-in Eve was warm, welcoming and gave us a briefing on the space and property, which was really nice. The property itself is so peaceful and the Sacred Garden is an absolute must while you’re here - it’s FREE!
We love the Gingerbread House! I lovely cottage in the Hawaiian jungle. There are windows all around and when you wake up you can see the lovely gnarled trees from the comfy queen bed.

Diese Unterkunft ist total süß und liegt super im Dschungel. Die Gastgeber sind total nett und erklären alles. Es war ein toller und unvergesslicher Urlaub! Toll das es solche Unterkünfte gibt! 
Der Ort ist auch total schön und entspannt  und es gibt alles was man braucht.
In der Unterkunft ist alles vorhanden, sogar Mückenspray, Sonnencreme, Kaffee und Schnorchel und Strandstühle.
Very lovely and secluded place surrounded by lush plants. Eve was very communicative. Good for those wanting to stay off the beaten path. Loved that they have cookies and coffee for guests!

Eve’s place is as advertised! A cute little place in a lush garden. She has thought of many things you will need and almost everything you could think of is available. She’s very knowledgeable about the island and is able to answer all of your questions. The only negative is the roosters that crow beginning around 2:00 am. Otherwise - the place is paradise!

My wife and I just spent a week at the Ginger Bread House and we loved it. We were really surprised with the amenities that Eve made available in the house. From the beach chairs, games, goggles, towels to the toiletries it was the little things that made our stay welcoming. The lot is beautiful and the people are very friendly.  A couple of tips to make your stay even better are to bring ear plugs. The roosters are great but they crow very early in the morning. Use the mosquito repellent. No explanation needed. No AC unit so the house can get warm during the day. You can open the windows and use the fan but the house will still be warm. Other than that we enjoyed our stay and definitely recommend it.

The minute you walk into the gated  property you are surrounded by beauty.  Eve took the time to sit down with Camelia and I and explain so many things about the island of Maui which was great for a couple first timers. Our cute little cabin withstood hurricane Lane so do fear that it doesn't have strong bones. Eve also runs a snorkeling/scuba trip which I would highly recommend. You get a great local feel vs. getting onto a large boat with 50 other tourists. The accommodations in the small cabin are endless. If you are looking for a more local upcountry feel and don't need to be next to a beach this is the place for you. The labyrinth is a great piece of art, there is endless amount of work done to it and is a very cool piece to an already beautiful area. I cant enough about how wonderful our trip was to the cabin. We will be back.
It was such a wonderful stay in the gingerbread house! Everything was like it is described. Mahalo Eve!
Great place, wonderful experience and very Hawaii. You won’t be disappointed
The gingerbread house is magical! A really special experience. The property is beautiful and Eve is a very welcoming host!

We knew we did not want to stay at a resort for our first trip to Maui so when we found the Adorable Garden Gingerbread House we fell for it right away (the nod to Jimmy Hendrix didn't hurt, either).  We wanted a relaxed environment, a chance to meet locals, and see the island.  So as we made our way from the big city airport, up roads that became more rural, with vegetation growing right up to the edge of the road, we knew we'd made the right decision.  And then you see the cottage; it is every bit adorable as you see in the photos.  The fainting couch is the best seat to view the monkey pod tree from the very large window.  We ate most meals out but we made coffee and had cereal at the cottage.  There are two grocery stores in Makawao and Haiku, two very close towns. You must walk the grounds to appreciate life in a rain forest:  bananas, pomegranates, coffee beans, and I think other fruits are growing within 50' of the cottage door.  The trickling stream came alive one night from a tropical storm that flooded parts of the beach areas but at 1000', didn't bother us; we were still acclimating to the time change so it just made for good sleeping.  We were very grateful for Steve's two minute Hawaiian language course.  Between the land and the language, you really know you're someplace else.  We had a car so getting around the island from Makawao was really easy.  
It's all true about the tropical climate (that things don't dry well) so get yourself some breathable tropical clothing.  People there mostly wear bathing suits/coverups anyway.
It's also true that the chickens are wild and everywhere on the island (except the volcano).  They're just like squirrels where we come from except some of them crow and not just at sunrise.  But we loved our chicken family and I swear we saw the three baby chicks grow in the week we were there.  They're not afraid of humans and were like a welcoming committee.  
Maui, Makawao, this cottage - it was all perfect for us.  My favorite bumper sticker said, "Slow down.  It's not the mainland".  Maui's really laid back so come to this cottage and relax.  Mahalo, Eve & Steve!

The Gingerbread House is truly a delight. A comfortable space, kept very well, it’s relaxing and the grounds are beautiful as well. The whole space is very welcoming. It’s also in a great location, close enough and far enough from everything. Eve provided all the essentials and was easy to reach for questions of any sort. Thank you Eve for sharing your slice of paradise.

It’s just as charming as you can imagine!! Honestly one of our favorite parts was the chickens all over! The sacred garden was a lovely place to visit and the house was beautiful and peaceful. The only thing we had just a touch of a complaint was the cedar smell. Don’t get me wrong, we both love the smell of fresh wood and everything, it was just a tad overwhelming. Again, just a personal preference, but overall we very much enjoyed our stay.

The gingerbread house is truly paradise. Eve was great and was very accommodating. She made sure we had everything we needed. The washer and dryer were a huge plus. This cottage is a jungle paradise. Super cute. The place was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. What else could you ever want?

my husband and I had a great stay at the gingerbread Cottage. It was extremely clean and had almost everything we needed. the bed was super comfortable and we had access to a washing machine and dryer every single day at no additional charge. Eve was even kind enough to leave Tide Pods for us to do our laundry. The bathroom was super roomy and we had plenty of storage space for our belongings. There were plenty of pots pans dishes and goodies for us when we got there. I thought it was very kind that they left Maui macadamia nut cookies and Maui coffee for us at no additional charge because hotels would charge you an arm and a leg for those additional amenities. we were also provided with boogie boards and yoga mats as well as a beach umbrella which was awesome because many resorts or hotels charge fees for those things and we thought it was really cool that Eve provided it with no additional charge. the property is nice because we truly felt like we were living like the locals but because of our location we were still close enough to enjoy all of the touristy Maui activities without having to travel too far. The gingerbread Cottage is literally like living in a jungle and the property is just gorgeous. there are mosquitoes and cane spiders ( which are huge) but we never saw a spider in our room and as long as we remembered to put bug spray on we never dealt with any mosquito problems. whenever we needed anything from toilet paper to ear earplugs to printed out boarding passes for a boat that we signed up to go for a sail on, eve was right there..... always responding within minutes of us reaching out to her and always helping us out within the hour. She was truly a very attentive host. She also has the sweetest golden retriever puppy we really enjoyed loving on and a secret garden that's open to the public that my husband and I really enjoyed visiting which is a must see when you're there. there are only a few things worth mentioning that might be bothersome for some people depending on what you expect out of the accommodations and I will mention those here. first thing is the shower. Everything on Maui is expensive so everyone has energy-efficient everything. Therefore, the shower only heats up for a couple of minutes. Eve says in her welcome book that the hot water lasts for 6 minutes but it feels a little shorter than that. she also says it only takes 10 minutes to heat up again after it gets cold but that's not true either. It takes a lot longer than 10 minutes to heat up again. So if you're the type of person that wants to take a nice long hot shower or if you're a couple and you guys want to shower immediately after each other, thats not going to happen at this Cottage. If my husband and I didn't take a shower together, we had to put aside about an extra hour or hour and a half so we could both have hot showers before we headed out. next, We were on our honeymoon so we didn't need a TV. But we were informed there was a TV and while there was no cable there was a DVD player so we thought we could watch our movies. but when we got there, there was no TV or DVD player in the room. so there is NO tv whatsoever. people should also know that there is no air conditioning and while Makawao is usually 10 degrees cooler than the outer parts of the island because it's UpCountry, there were still nights that I woke up in a sweat because I was hot. We weren't miserable or anything but there were definitely some days that especially when trying to sleep it would have been nice to have access to air conditioning and not just a stand-up fan. the only other thing that might drive people a little nuts is the Roosters. Wherever you go on the island of Maui there are wild chickens and roosters everywhere. So there's tons of these feathery guys on Eves property as they are a farm. we truly loved our feathery friends and we truly felt we bonded with them and they really didn't bother us initially..... but after about day 6 or 7 of waking up to our favorite rooster doing his morning rooster call at 4 a.m. we we're starting to get a little Punchy because we were losing sleep. So we had to reach out to Eve and she was kind enough to give us earplugs which helped me a lot but didn't really help my husband. so anyone that would have a problem with a rooster call at 4 am, you should reach out to eve before you get there and let her know that you want her to lure those chickens and roosters to another part of the property before you get there. also it's a little hard to get a decent Wi-Fi signal out there. like I said, we were on our honeymoon so the things I mentioned in here were very minor for us and didnt bother us at all really.... but depending on what you're hoping to get out of your stay we thought we should mention them because technology and basic things like long hot showers are taken for granted and people may not realize how important it is to them until they don't have access to it. We really like to be detached from everyone and everything and we don't like to be doted on and we aren't Resort people, so the things I mentioned were fine for us but for people that are typically Resort people, it may be quite the adjustment. personally, we absolutely loved our stay and we're talking about trying...

Eve’s cottage is great if you  are looking for a peaceful place to stay in Maui. If you are looking for a place away from a lot of other tourists and in a more rural environment, this would be it! The scenery is beautiful and the cottage is very nice. My husband and I loved the chickens, but if you are someone who would be irritated at chickens crowing at 5 am or earlier, this may not be the environment for you. They kept us on a great schedule for the week, especially since the sun goes down early in Maui. Eve added extra touches, such as coffee, cookies, beach towels, and bug spray, which were all very much appreciated and used. The cottage does not have a TV, but who needs one when you can watch the geckos on the windows at night and look at the beautiful scenery? Great stay! Very relaxing. We recommend.

Beautiful cottage in an amazing garden. We loved it. Everything was perfect for us. Only the rooster was a little bit loud during the night. But for us it was no problem at all. We can fully recommend this great place.
It was a quiet, serene place, if you want to unplug & enjoy Maui’s upcountry, this is the  perfect location.

Eve's place was awesome and beautiful just like in the pictures. I would definitely stay there again. It was close to everything that we needed and Eve was super helpful, and great at responding quickly. Will definitely miss the wild chickens running around everywhere! :)

The Gingerbread House is so adorable! It is nestled in a great hideaway spot in Makawao but is really close to town and Paia. The grounds are beautiful from the various plants and fruits to the sacred garden that is within walking distance. Eve is a great host and was so attentive during our entire stay from greeting us at check-in to giving us a tour of the grounds. We hope to be back soon!

We LOVED this space! The land is peaceful and nestled into such beauty. The gingerbread home is super cozy and plenty of space for a couple's restful time together. We will definitely be back for another visit!
Die Unterkunft ist sehr süß und liegt  zentral auf der Insel. Man erreicht alles sehr flott mit einem Mietwagen.
Great secluded place that makes for a unique experience on a beautiful island!

The place was amazing, amazing area, perfect for outdoors, great lights for out side activities at night. The inside was a dream cottage unreal and made you believe all dreams are true while letting your imagination run wild. This was a wonderful place and I would recommend everyone to stay here.
Great experience!  Eve was welcoming and a fantastic host. I highly recommend this cute cottage.

The property is stunning. Thanks for a beautiful setting! We loved staying up in the hills for a few days... relaxing, chill, yet super close to all great parts of the north shore - hookipa, Paia, haiku, baby beach etc. fantastic spot and great hospitality.
Amazing location. Good value. Well worth the stay

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Eve’s adorable Gingerbread house! It was exactly how we imagined it would be. So quaint and perfect for our 3 nights in the “up country”. Eve was such a gracious host and took a lot of time showing us around the grounds and giving us the history on the place. It was in a great location. Short drive down to Paia to the ocean to watch awesome surfers. And a quick drive into the cute town of Makawao for great restaurants and cute shops. Also easy access to the Road to Hana and watching the Sunrise at the Summit. With our short stay we didn’t eat in but enjoyed the nice touches of coffee and treats Eve left us. Loved the Roosters mulling around but be aware they do make noises early in the morning (even at 2am) but that didn’t bother us much as it helped us get an early start to our days. Plus our noise cancelling headphones help . The bed was very comfortable and loved the cooler weather at night with all the windows open. Would definitely stay here again. Mahalo 
Eve!
Kindness, beauty, and beautiful and tranquil property. The sacred garden is a special place. Thank you!

The Gingerbread House is even more adorable in person.   It is a garden of Eden in the upcountry of Maui.  We loved sitting in the backyard having coffee in the morning and dinner in the evening.  The cottage is well furnished and sparkling clean!  The bed sleeps great!  We loved our stay here and would highly recommend this accommodation!

We stood for 4 days at this little paradise. Wish it would be longer.Maui is great.We surrounded the island with a car we rented so we could see much of the island. Eves place is perfect located to start your trip every day and drive around the (Website hidden by Airbnb) both directions  The little paradise Eve and Steven created with Gingerbread House is a very special place you have to be!At least you have to visit Eves secret garden with its exotic plants and labyrinths!Adorable!!!Thank you for this great host!
Beautiful grounds. The description of the place is very accurate. Eve is a great host who had everything we needed for a very comfortable stay. Definitely recommended.

This is a beautiful jungle hideaway with many surprises to be discovered. We unexpectedly had our children join us on our romantic getaway, so our adventure changed. It was special to have them and to explore and pick fruit, but I would recommend a larger accommodation on the property if you plan to have more than two people staying. Eve is helpful and generously communicative. The place was clean and had everything you could need, and more. Location is fantastic, too.

name: Triple Room  - Ocean's 7 Hotel
summary: Hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Istanbul's Sultanahmet district-which is the mark of turkish hospitality and culture and easy access to all public transports and allows you to get to all main touristic atractions by walk.Set in the old town of Sultanahmet, place is just a short walk from the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar. A great choice for travellers interested in sightseeings,in monuments, architecture and history.Couples particularly like the location.
space: Guests can enjoy a traditional Turkish breakfast buffet including homemade jams, Turkish-style omelettes and biscuits can be enjoyed on the hotel’s rooftop terrace with magnificent views of the Blue Mosque, Princes Islands and the Marmara sea. This property also has one of the best-rated locations and the best value in İstanbul! Guests are happier about it compared to other properties in the area . Guests are getting more for their money when compared to other properties in this city.

A great choice for travellers interested in sightseeings,in monuments, architecture and history.Couples particularly like the location. Guests can enjoy a traditional Turkish breakfast buffet including homemade jams, Turkish-style omelettes and biscuits can be enjoyed on the hotel’s rooftop terrace with magnificent views of the Blue Mosque, Princes Islands and the Marmara sea. This property also has one of the best-rated locations and the best value in İstanbul! Guests are happier about it compared to other properties in the area . Guests are getting more for their money when compared to other properties in this city. Relax at t
neighborhood_overview: Visit the Great Palace Mosaics Museum just moments away, and the Museum of Turkish and Islamic Arts, within a 3-minute walk. Return to delicious food in the restaurant and a favourite drink at the attractive bar. Taksim Square is 3.7 miles away and can be arrived in 20 minutes via tram and funicular.  CLOSEST SIGHTSEEİNG PLACES Topkapi Palace  0.2 km Arasta Bazaar    0.1 km Basilica Cistern     0.3 km Mosaic Museum   0.2 km Blue Mosque    0.3 km Grand Bazaar  0.9 km Turkish and islamic arts museum    0.4 km Archaeological museum   0.5 km    Hagia Sophia     0.4 km Column of Constantine    0.8 km Spice Bazaar  (Egyptian Market)  1.5 km Suleymaniye Mosque    1.8 km
notes: Please don't hesitate to contact with us if you have any additional questions and needs.  We are happy to provide assistance.
transit: We offer pick up service from/to airport with reasonable prices. For this service we need your flight number and arrival time. And our friend (driver) will meet you at the exit of customs holding a sign with your name.
access: Relax at the hotel small  garden at the entrance until ready to go out. Movies can be watched on the large plasma-screen TV from comfortable sofas in the cosy lobby.  Rooftop is available 24 hours which offers you to enjoy the stunning view of the city, Marmara Sea and Blue Mosque.
interaction: You will find very friendly and pleasant accommodation.The 24-hour reception can help arrange tours to Istanbul’s main sights. Friendly staff at tour desk can arrange car rental,ticket service and city tours to popular areas and local attractions in the city with big discounted rates for our guests.

reviews.comments: The host canceled this reservation 12 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

name: STUDIO IN COPACABANA
summary: COPACABANA POSTO 5, UPPER FLOOR, SUITE WITH INTERNAL GARDEN, BUNK BEDS OR DOUBLE BED AS REQUESTED, NEXT DOOR, LIVING ROOM WITH DOUBLE SOFA BED, WHICH IN THE CASE OF THE SAME GROUP MAY ALSO BE USED. AIRY WITH DIRECT SUN, OVERLOOKING THE COMMUNITY OF PAVÃO (PEACEFUL). THIS BRIGHT AND AIRY APARTMENT PROVIDES EASY ACCESS TO ALL MAJOR TOURIST ATTRACTIONS, TWO MINUTES WALK TO THE BEACH, 5 METERS FROM COPACABANA AND IPANEMA, 10 MINUTES FROM ALL THE SERVICES AND AMENITIES AROUND THE PROPERTY.  UPON ENTERING THE APARTMENT YOU WILL FIND A COMFORTABLE SITTING ROOM, WITH TWO BEDROOMS AND KITCHEN, GOING UP THE STAIRS YOU WILL BE DAZZLED BY A PENTHOUSE JUST FOR YOU WITH A NOOK WITH CABLE TV WITH A MULTITUDE OF CHANNELS AND WITH INTERNET (WI FI) ALL OVER THE HOUSE, A SUITE AND A BALCONY WHERE YOU CAN ENJOY AN OPEN PLACE WITH PLANTS , A SHOWER, A BARBECUE AND A MINIBAR.

host.host_location: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
host.host_about: Uma pessoa simpatica, extrovertida, que adora viajar e receber hospedes

address.street: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

reviews.comments: Minha estadia no apartamento do Sergio foi excelente. Ele é um anfitrião extremamente atencioso e gentil, nos deixou muito à vontade e confortáveis. As fotos mostram exatamente como é o ambiente, muito limpo, organizado e agradabilíssimo. Certamente recomendo como opção de estadia. O prédio é seguro, muito bem localizado.

Como fue la estadía en la casa de Sergio?....fantástica!!! No pudo ser mejor!. Su casa es hermosa, muy cómoda, con una excelente ubicación. Pero mas allá de todo eso, Sergio es una muy linda persona, súper agradable, con quien da ganas de compartir momentos. 
Llegamos a su casa por una relación contractual (el alquiler de un cuarto en su casa) y nos fuimos sintiendo que estuvimos en la casa de un familiar, de un amigo. Gracias Sergio por hacernos sentir así! La verdad no lo esperábamos y nos sorprendió gratamente. 
Decir que fue un excelente anfitrión es poco. Siempre pendiente de nosotros, desde antes de nuestra llegada, durante nuestra estadía y al finalizar la misma. Aconsejándonos que medio de trasporte utilizar, que ir a conocer, etc.
